Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: Stella Y
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a little bit hard to find,but very close to the central attractions. The parking fee was very reasonable comparing with other sydney hotels. The room is big and clean. Nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Nicole E
Reviews.Content: Good location and nice restaurant for lunch. Close to market and we were able to walk everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “You can find better”
Reviews.Author: happyholiday66
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in Haymarket, it is run down and could use a makeover. The staff were helpfull on check in, but they were very rude when checking out. This hotel is a disapointment, they have a roof top pool and spa but they looked dirty. The room was a good size but for the price paid ($140) it was not worth the money. There are better value hotels in Sydney most of which are closer to shops, restaurants etc.

Reviews.Title: “Tidy, safe place to stay”
Reviews.Author: 12four_eyed_girl
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with a group of friends and then returned after leaving other accommodation that was well below par. Citigate is clean and warm and I felt safe as a lone female traveller once my friends left. Food in restaurant and room service was delicious. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised, nice place”
Reviews.Author: snuffy_my_dog
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in December the night before our cruise. It is in a great location. You can walk to Darling Harbour, Paddys Markets are down the road. It was so great. The room was basic, comfortable. We had 2 kids and it fit us all comfortably. The breakfast was pretty average. The service was terrible. It took 3 times to get a portacot delivered, and that was even in the email booking. It eventually came as a bed at 1130pm!! Then was taken back and brought back as a cot. The kitchen staff were also very short, dropped items and did not return to pick things up. I would return for the great location and hope that the service improves.

Reviews.Title: “A nice surprise”
Reviews.Author: JodieG68
Reviews.Content: I was not expecting much for the price (last minute deal on wotif) but was pleasantly surprised. The twin room was very generous in size and nice clean facilities. The bathrooms clean but a little dated but not dirty, just old. Only stayed the one night but would definitely consider this hotel again, even for a longer stay as there is plenty of room to swing a cat. Good location in the centre of Sydney an easy walk to the Convention Centre.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly & Obliging staff”
Reviews.Author: phil_seymour
Reviews.Content: I am a regular user of this centrally located hotel for business. i now have staff at registration who greet me by name and nothing is ever a problem [ from lost car parking ticket, to borrowing a steam iron]. They are always friendly. Rooms are comfortable & some bathrooms may need an upgrade. Cheap car parking is attached to the hotel & it is not far from the CBD.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: KMH21
Reviews.Content: Great location - perfect for Chinatown, and Darling Harbour, and close to the Capitol Theatre. Very helpful and polite staff. Room a little dated, as was the bathroom, with only 2 bath towels and limited guest ammenities - only shampoo and soap! Expected a bit more for a 4 and half star hotel. Breakfast was fabulous - certainly worth having (was advised to book in for breakfast on arrival as it is cheaper @ $19.00 compared to the $24.00 charged on the day)

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: nen f
Reviews.Content: This located right around chinatown and close to most places to visit abd sight see in downtown Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “An Average Experience”
Reviews.Author: surfagurl
Reviews.Content: The room was spacious, but sparsely furnished. Bathroom dated. Considering the price tag of $250+ per night it was incredibly average. The breakfast: I probably wouldn't bother & just go to a nice cafe instead. The main issues: * When the bathroom got steamy I could see writing in the mirror (see attached photo) hand prints & writing that said "I see you" - very creepy. * I mistakenly left my mobile charger in the room after I checked out. I approached the front office staff & asked them see if Housekeeping could retrieve it for me, I was advised that it wasn't in the room. I insisted that they re-check & that I'd return after my conference to collect it. 2 hours later I returned to reception to be told it definitely wasn't in the room. Yet again I explained where it was & that I knew it was there & asked them to check again. In the meantime I needed to leave to make my flight. Sure enough they hotel called & they had it. Today it arrives - but get this ... they charged the postage on collection!!!! Ok, I acknowledge it was my error in the first place, but the cheek of charging me for the postage when they told me on 2 occasional that it wasn't there when it was PLUS they never told me they were going to charge me the postage! Absolutely appalling service.

Reviews.Title: “My choice hotel to stay at in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: JCM2575
Reviews.Content: I travel to Sydney regularly for business and always choose to stay at Citigate. The staff are always polite and professional, the rooms are great, and the location is walking distance to everything you need. Tonight I walked to the theatre and back and felt totally safe the whole way. I fully recommend this hotel to both business travelers and tourists alike.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay, Staff pleasant & Helpful”
Reviews.Author: TheJourneyMan812
Reviews.Content: Booked through Wotif.com. This was a mystery hotel booking, $150.00 a night. Allocated a top floor room with King Bed nothing flash but very comfortable. Facilities in the room were adequate and in good condition. The location was ideal close to central & only a short walk to the SCEC Darling Harbour. A good variety of eateries around to choose from, predominantly Chinese/ Asian. There are a few decent bar/pubs nearby to relax in close by Reception staff were pleasant & helpful both at check in & out, housekeeping staff were also friendly & pleasant. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good value”
Reviews.Author: Gemmy81
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at the Citigate several times, most recently with our baby. The rooms, although a little older are clean and very roomy for a city hotel. Was loving the bath tub for bubba! The staff have always been very nice, the doorman in particular who helped us with the pram upstairs after hours and the parking is very good. We like the location as it is close to Darling Harbour, Chinatown and often get on the monorail if we don't feel like walking back from the city with our shopping. Good value for the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great location pathetic service”
Reviews.Author: themanwhostayed
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a fantastic location and very close to everything. The room was great and I deeply enjoyed the swimming pool. The problem was the staff. I booked the hotel through the mystery deal on wotif where it said either a king size bed or 2 singles. I called a week earlier to reconfirm the booking with reeservations and informed them that it was my anniversary and if we could put in a request for a king size bed. She sounded as if she couldnt care less but I still asked her to put a note on my profile. Guess what we had 2 single/Queen beds. The receptionist seemed distracte and just said they dint have any other rooms availabIe. I wasnt asking for an upgrade here..just wanted 1 bed and not 2. Next thing was concierge. I ordered room service in the morning for breakfast and also requested for the morning paper, and i called the concierge and informed him of the same and requested it to be broughten up to my room asap. After having waited for 30 mins I called the concierge again just to be informed that hey did not have any more newspapers and that they would be happy to point out the directions to nearest newsagency... HAHAHA is this service or a joke??? even if they would have offered to get it for ma and charge it to my account I would have been ok, but give directions?? and not mentioning the lack of follow up and communication. You have made a promise to a guest ( even if it is something as small as a newspaper) please make sure you get back to them.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Accommodation with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: HomeSHome
Reviews.Content: My husband and I along with my 2 girls aged 10 and 12 stayed at Citigate Central Sydney for 2 nights and we couldn't have asked for more. We had a great room on the 8th floor, our room had a sliding door which lead onto a little verandah and garden and also a heated pool which is very clean and inviting. The rooms were really clean and comfy and it was so quiet at night so sleeping was no problem. The staff which includes house keeping and the door men were always polite and acknowledged us if we passed them in the hall way. The buffet brekky was to die for and if you like a sleep in, that's ok because their brekky goes till 11am. Citigate central is exactly that, central to the entertainment centre, paddys markets, chinatown and you can just jump on the monorail and in a few minutes youre at THE STAR. Has undercover parking. Would definately recommend Citigate and they will definately see me and my family back there.

Reviews.Title: “not bad for a mystery deal on wotif”
Reviews.Author: Aussi_traveller_77
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good location and reception staff was always smiling and helpful. The little roof pool was a bonus, but the room was a bit tired. It was good for a mystery deal but I'm not sure if I would have liked to pay full price for it.

Reviews.Title: “Well Placed and Nice Spot for Sydney !”
Reviews.Author: MichaelandAnne
Reviews.Content: A well placed hotel for the City, Markets, transport, China Town, Darling Harbour and the footie and cricket. Quite a safe spot if you move about at normal hours. Good car parking right beside. Has a good restaurant - nothing flash - but good food. A bar and lovely foyer area. Easy walk to the main shopping area of Sydney - or a quick bus ride. Tour Groups did have an affect on the hotel over time - but it is now refurbished and tries to accommodate all types. I'd place it at the 3.5 to 4 stars. Nice pool and friendly staff. Little, to no noise for sleeping. Being opposite Central Rail Station it is very good for transport to anywhere in Sydney - or a good overnighter for the airport, cruising, or just day-trippers. Busses leave from around the corner to everywhere - all the time. Big plus - if driving to Sydney - it is in a VERY easy spot to enter and leave the City - especially from the South. The front rooms are better - but dearer - but many rooms have twin (proper) double beds - so great for kids - a good sized bathroom and a great view from the front. We've stayed here many times. Check the net for specials.

Reviews.Title: “Great work/play Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tina L
Reviews.Content: Travelled to Sydney for work and stayed the weekend. Excellent location to Chinaown - walking distance. Rooms spacious with generous lounge, coffee table and decent sized table for tea/coffee as well as writing desk. Staff were pleasant and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Dishonest and disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Bruce G
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this property 6 times over the last 4 years. Citgate has slowly gone downhill the busier it has become. We have never questioned a bill or had reason to until our last stay. When we arrived we were told the room rate which we had booked was 20% higher than quoted. We paid and got on with enjoying our trip. We contacted the hotel after the stay to complain about the difference between the quoted and charged price, to be told we were wrong not the hotel. We work in hospitality and travel a lot, vote with our feet and our feet say "the Citigate is dishonest and disappointing"

Reviews.Title: “Central Location”
Reviews.Author: jandk_95
Reviews.Content: Huge room in the city, clean and well maintained. The staff werre friendly and attentive.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel close to trains and markets”
Reviews.Author: Kanade
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for a week on business. It's in a good location to the south of the CBD, close to Central Station, Paddy's Markets and Chinatown, so there's plenty of restaurants and shops around the area. It's a bit of a walk to Darking Harbour, and further still to Pitt St Mall and Circular Quay. Sydney is expensive, but the hotel seemed relatively good value for money. The room looked rather tired - especially the bathroom. I'm sure everything here pre-dated the Sydney Olympics. My colleagues complained of noisy neighbours to their rooms, but I lucked out and had a quiet stay. The room was not afforded a great view - I was looking straight into an office building. There was an LCD TV but the stations were analogue and distorted. I tried room service on two occasions - it was tasty, but slow and expensive. Given my work commitments I wasn't too fussed with the hotel, but if I were coming back to Sydney as a tourist I'd look elsewhere

Reviews.Title: “Great location! 4* Mystery deal booked via Wotif.com”
Reviews.Author: l_ben88
Reviews.Content: My mother and I booked this hotel as a Wotif mystery deal for $140/pn for a twin room for our short trip to Sydney. Upon check-in/check-out the staff were very friendly, helpful and professional, which made for a nice stay. Our room on the 9th floor was well appointed, spacious and maintained to a good standard - beds were large and comfortable enough, tea and coffee making facilities well stocked during our stay and rooms aptly cleaned everyday. We had to close our curtains a few time as we were directly opposite and within close proximity to a large office building â€“ though we were out most of the day, so this didnâ€™t affect us a great deal. The pool & attached spa were a treat and open till an appropriate time in the evening (10pm) which meant we could go for a relaxing dip after returning from a huge day of sightseeing (not too many children about either which was peaceful :) ) We did notice the construction work across the road but never really heard any disruptive noises etc. We opted to leave out breakfast at the hotel, so canâ€™t comment on this (though skip the charge and head down the road to the beautiful Chinese garden for some lovely scones and tea!). Same goes for internet â€“ not sure what the rates are, there are e a few computers available for use in the lobby though which may be handy for some. Overall we had a pleasant stay and would consider returning in the future if booked at the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Handy location”
Reviews.Author: loveholidays11
Reviews.Content: This is a good value for money hotel, for the Centre of Sydney in a handy location to Darling Harbour and China Town and the theatre district. We have been here twice as a family, the first time experiencing a restless night as the neighbours were partying with loud music all night. We contacted Security several times and they managed to quieten the neighbours but they continued with the loud music into the early hours of the morning. It was very unsettling for our very young daughter and us. The following night was quiet so we returned another time. We returned to try it again as the room rate offered was good value and were upgraded to a suite at the top of the Hotel and parking, so thanks to the Manager at the hotel. It was a huge room and seemingly quiet until a strange noise like a pump noise came from inside the wall every 10 minutes. It wasn't a problem at first but we ended up needing ear plugs to sleep at night. The bathroom was relatively small and renovated, which was nice but no bath which we really missed. The beds too were extremely uncomfortable and yet the beds in the queen rooms we had on another occasion were fine. Even though some of the staff were friendly, don't expect good service. The breakfast area is self serve and the staff are not accommodating if you mention that supplies were running out. They told me they already know about it and were very unhappy that we spoke to them. The staff at reception were the same, they went from being very friendly and nice to not speaking and very surley. The hotel is a real contradiction, "hit and miss" but in a handy location. The pool was lovely and warm, but dirty with a huge grimey area around the top. It was school holidays, so perhaps it was heavily used. There were also not enough towels left. I agree with another reviewer, when the construction begins across the road, there could be noise and chaos but they seemed to be excavating some historical sections, which could take some time yet before the foundations are put in.

Reviews.Title: “What a great holiday”
Reviews.Author: Chrissie2800
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, just a short walk from central station. On arrival was greeted and taken care of immediatly by the friendly staff. The room was nicely decorated and quite modern. The pool was a bonus as I was with my children, who really enjoyed it. It was clean and there were towels provided in the pool area. The hotel is so central to all the big attractions the city has to offer. All were within walking distance. There are plenty of places to eat close by. Paddys Market and China Town just down the street. The Breakfast provided by the hotel was of high quality. There is a lot of variety to choose from. Overall had a great relaxing stay with all my needs catered for. Would not hesitate to return or recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Consistant”
Reviews.Author: Warrens_of_Conder
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here several times in a variety of rooms since my last review in 2007. The hotel has been taken over by Mirvac group and over the past 18 months or so they have been doing quite extensive renovations, which the hotel badly needed. It appears from reading some of the reviews that not all of the rooms have been renovated as yet (especially bathrooms, the older rooms have grey tiles and a bath, newer have a shower and white tiles in the bathroom). Request a renovated room on check in as they are considerably better. Our last visit was for three nights in early January. We had booked an 8th floor balcony room (all rooms on the 8th floor and some of the king rooms on other floors have balconies) for the four of us over the hotels web site, but on arrival were 'upgraded' to a king room on the 18th floor with views over darling harbour (I suspect that the hotel over booked themselves) This was a much larger room, newly renovated and had great views over to Darling Harbour. Pre purchased breakfast (cheaper option than pay as you go) and parking in the hotels car park. We had a comfortable stay and would recommend except for a couple of niggling issues which need fixing. Breakfast is inconsistant (they seem to get slammed and then the food runs low, or out, crockery/cutlery runs out, and depending on who cooks flavours vary). What is with toasters in this place, two domestic toasters to serve a restaurant of 100 pax?? Also waitstaff 'please smile at your guests' at least try? Towels, have stayed here several times, four guests need four towels not two or three every day we had to request extra!. That said the place is well positioned about 12 minute walk to Darling Harbour, 5 to the monorail and about 30 mins to Circular quay (via George St) Please note that construction is just starting accross the road for new apartment block, so expect some noise and congestion around the hotel for the next couple of years.

Reviews.Title: “Booked through sshhh deal and got a great deal.”
Reviews.Author: Kate W
Reviews.Content: Very nice big hotel but service wasn't lacking. Unimpressive pool considering the photos on the website but still a pool to cool down in. Right next to central station so handy for that and darling harbour.

Reviews.Title: “enjoyed the views & buffet breakky was great.”
Reviews.Author: superj1978
Reviews.Content: visited for a show at the capitol theatre. the room was very well appointed, the bed was comfy and the view from above was awesome! the breakfast was great too.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel good location”
Reviews.Author: kojak069
Reviews.Content: ive stayed at this hotel a few times and have enjoyed my stays here. The rooms are a good size and are clean and comfortable . Its only a short walk to public transport, Darling harbour and china town. There is a parking station next to the hotel if you have a car. I would stay here again .

Reviews.Title: “4th visit and still happy”
Reviews.Author: madgely
Reviews.Content: We stayed on 23rd December 2011 and member of staff on Reception was very helpful - upgraded us to a City View room as we did not require the balcony and it was a much better view of the city and pool.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but average service”
Reviews.Author: dprebble
Reviews.Content: The plus of this hotel is the location. Close to trains, shopping, Darling Harbour, etc. Many places to eat. Although the staff were friendly, we had major problems with one of the 2 rooms we booked. 1 room was meant for 3 adults. At 2 pm the room wasn't ready, at 5:30 pm we got key and found out the room had 1 king bed only for 3 adults. Reception told us they would bring up bed. After dinner at 9:30 pm we went back to room and still no bed. Had too complain and got bed straight away. The bed was a roll out that wasn't made up and all dusty. Not happy. Facilities were clean and working. Pool was very nice but on the small side. Great views of city. Only average for $250 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lovely staff, desperately needs an upgrade”
Reviews.Author: AAMelb
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here while visiting family over Christmas. The hotel is in a great central location, and has car parking on site for around $23 per day for guests. The foyer is lovely and the staff are really helpful.... but the rooms are not good at all. The room we were originally booked into was so bad we complained. We're not 'complainers' usually, and I can handle modest, but this room was so run down it felt dirty. We were moved to another room, which was better, but only marginally. Really got the feeling that the staff are used to complaints about the place - which is a real shame for the staff, as they were all fantastic! Honestly, as you can see in my photos, the carpet in the first room we were in was so stained it looked like someone had been stabbed in there or something! The rooms were refreshed daily, but the towels and linen reeked of bleach, which was a little disconcerting. In our 'upgrade' room the bathroom was in bad condition - broken tiles, chipped enamel and dirty grouting - and because there are no exhaust fans the ceilings are getting a lovely coating of mildew. The bench for luggage looked like it was about to collapse and the furniture was old and falling apart. At one point I pulled down to doona to discover the sheets didn't even cover the whole bed! I have to say though that the staff were fantastic - one girl in particular, I think her name was Elly, was so friendly and accommodating. We ordered room service once, for breakfast Christmas morning. Nothing to write home about but fine. I booked this place as a 'secret deal' through wotif, and it is supposed to be four star, and it may have been once, but it's sure not any more. It's really central and convenient, but I wouldn't stay again, unless I knew the place had had a major update.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Korinamcintyre
Reviews.Content: This was my first stop in Australia travelling with a friend we booked a twin room on the 9th floor. The hotel has a holiday inn feel to it - within walking distance of the train station and Hyde park + surrounded by shops this is a good base if all you want is somewhere to sleep. Beds were comfortable and rooms were clean. The shower was powerful and the water was always hot. I slept very well though my friend said she could hear the theme tunes from the theatre across the street - mary poppins was showing :-) The breakfast was average but as I said you are surrounded by places to eat. The room has a fridge which is a bonus.

Reviews.Title: “not sure...”
Reviews.Author: packedbags2010
Reviews.Content: Hotel is location conveniently located right near Central Station and Chinatown. There is a little bit of a walk to get to the shops. Staff were friendly. Rooms were average...a tad run down though :(

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in every possible way”
Reviews.Author: Blissyu2
Reviews.Content: We got this hotel as a Wotif mystery deal for $157/pn for a couple and what we ended up with was a magnificent hotel located right near Central Station, a perfect spot to get around Sydney on our holiday. The service was unbelievably good, from helping us to check in early and check out late, through to taking care of our luggage after we had checked out and just being there to help with every little thing we could ask for. The only minor problem was that we wanted a king sized bed and instead got 2 twin beds, which wasn't ideal and the views were pretty poor. Definitely worth staying at again and I would recommend this to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Central to Chinatown”
Reviews.Author: oceanroad4
Reviews.Content: Great location as we were going to Chinatown for a Christmas Party and could walk there from Thomas Street which is only 6/10minutes walk from the Lion Gates of Chinatown. We got a great upgrade to a city Veiw room and parking wa included in the room rate a must as parking is at a premium in this part of town.

Reviews.Title: “Low hygiene standards: cockroach on bed”
Reviews.Author: zentree
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights in this hotel and until the second night we were giving it an "average" rating. The room had seen better days, it was dark for working and one could see the dust in the corners. Our last night we had a large Sydney cockroach on the bed! (cockroaches never travel around and carry a host of diseases). After killing the cockroach and taking it to reception I had a very unhelpful conversation with the duty manager who explained the hotel was full and could not offer another room. My impression was that he was trying more to cover up the situation rather than offer options. At the end (and after some discussion), the hotel offered free breakfast and a late (3pm) check-out. However, this not even remotely compensated for the poor night sleep we had after the cockroach(es) incident. The hotel was not cheap so I would suggest other travelers to look for alternative accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “You've got to be kidding”
Reviews.Author: David G
Reviews.Content: The hotel is close to Central Station and very convenient to get to from the Airport. The hotel is trying to be fashionable, but is tired and worn out. The price is a bit high, in my opinion. I pay less for nice hotels in Tokyo. But what really gets me is the internet service. It has a daily download limit of 300MB. Watch one Youtube video, or have a 3 minute Skype conversation, and you're done for the day. If you don't need internet, well then it's just an alright hotel. If you're a business traveler, and rely on the internet. Then you'd best find a different hotel, 'cause you're not going to get your work done here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay in the city”
Reviews.Author: squidgybutt
Reviews.Content: My wife was a bit concerned after reading some of the reviews for this hotel but after we got there and checked in all her worries faded.The check in was quick and easy every friendly lady with a french accent,,late check out and parking no worries at all,, housekeeping very nice brought extra towels and glasses without even having to ask. The rooms may be a bit dated to todays standards but still very functional and comfortable. The pool was great, heated which was good as the kids still wanted to go swimming even when it was cold. Buffet breakfast was good lot to choose from. The breakfast staff I felt were a bit rude, but maybe just very stressed with the breakfast rush. In all our stay was very nice peaceful, will stay there again...

Reviews.Title: “Good Central Hotel at good price”
Reviews.Author: salad2964
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in Sydney many times on work-related business, however this is the first time I had stayed at the Citigate Central. As this was a work conference with bulk booking of rooms, I thought I would get one of the least modern rooms, but this wasn't the case. The room was very large, nice flat screen TV, the bathroom could have done with a revamp as the grout had gone mouldy in quite a few places. There was obvious signs of wear and tear around the room, but nothing bad at all. The room was very quiet and the queen bed was quiet comfortable. I didn't hear a thing from outside the room once in bed. The breakfast and lunch supplied as part of our conference at the Citigate were both very impressive. I enjoyed both meals as did I enjoy the morning and afternoon tea offered as part of the conference package. We walked down to Darling Harbour precinct for dinner, and although the walk as a bit long, it was enjoyable after being inside all day. The conference room was just perfect in size for our needs and apart from a loud crowd in an adjoining conference room and the air con which was a bit cold, despite asking for it to be turned up a couple of times, I don't think the temperature changed at all. The conference room had a balcony as part of the break out area, which was pretty nice. All in all, I dont think the stay there was bad at all. Could do with disabled rooms, which they don't seem to have and I thought would almost be mandatory with any renovation now in such a modern multicultural city as Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “OK for a bed for the night”
Reviews.Author: veedee57
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on Wotif as a "Mystery Hotel" for our brief one night stay before we headed off to the south coast. Our room on the 9th floor was quite bland and is in need of an update but it was very quiet and we heard no noise from other guests. The staff were friendly and the location was good for our requirements as it is within walking distance of Chinatown.

Reviews.Title: “Citigate sydney”
Reviews.Author: topcat30
Reviews.Content: We got Wotif mystrey deal and got citigate hotel ,Room had 2 king size beds,Staff very friendly and helpful,also this hotel has a airpport shuttle which was good $14 per person.and you can leave your bags at the hotel for the day.Room was clean maybe a little dated but enjoyed our stay. short walk to china town and the markets also short walk to centrel station and darling harbour.

Reviews.Title: “Great central location no need for a car but.....”
Reviews.Author: Alcheringasailing
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in Sydney on business about 5 times at different hotels in a price range of $125-$350 per night The best being Swisshotel, We had two nights at this hotel it was not the best at any price. The reception staff are very welcoming and willing to help with anything you needed, We got a good rate for this hotel so I think it was good value for the price given its central location, But would not have wanted to pay more as the hotel seem to need some maintenance. The cleaners are less than impressive, the shower floor was black with mould and the grout was dirty.... could go on but you get the idea(Would not recommend leaving valuables in the room,as we had some money taken from our room) the house keeper must have thought it was payment for not cleaning it properly. Breakfast buffet was very nice with a good variety freshly made hot and cold food (TIP PREPAY BREAKFAST ITS CHEAPER.) If you don't wish to dine here there are plenty of food outlets with in short walking distance Swimming pool was warm which was good as it was quite cold when we were there there is also a hot spa The gym had good equipment which was in use both times we tried to use it so may have been a bit small It was possible we had higher expectations of a Citigate hotel, as we had stayed at the Citigate Brisbane prior which is a much better hotel so don't expect this hotel to be up to the same standard Saying this I would stay again depending on the hotels price and availability of other hotels

Reviews.Title: “Badly needs a refurbishment”
Reviews.Author: Bharatvanshi
Reviews.Content: Definitely not a 4 star hotel. The age of the hotel is showing, especially in the bathrooms in the rooms. They've kept the function rooms and reception areas nice but forgotten about the actual rooms. You expect at least an above average bathroom when you pay for a 4 star hotel, but here they are ancient and very ordinary, with simple plain tiles and fittings you'd find in a modest house, not a 4 star hotel. There are only two lifts servicing some 18 floors, and if your room is on the higher floors, it can be a commute to get down to reception. It took them days to get the Internet in my room working. And no it wasn't wifi. The buffet breakfast was expensive and didnt have much variety.

Reviews.Title: “Shaky Start To A Smooth Ride...”
Reviews.Author: immax101
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel and was keen to come back for another pleasant stay. However this time I booked on the internet, and not through a travel agent as I had before. That will teach me! The site said that our room came with a balcony, and as I had noticed on my previous stay, not all rooms came with a balcony - so after making the booking I quickly rang the the website to confirm that would indeed have a balcony room...to which they promised. However upon arrival I brought this up at Check-In and a Balcony Room had not been specified at all...VERY annoying! After a lengthy discussion with the Receptionist who initially said that we shouldn't exepct an automatic upgrade (Which we didn't - we just expected the room we booked!) she finally relented and met us halfway by only giving us a part charge for upgrading our room. ...Can I please make it clear that this was not the Hotels' fault, and may I warn you to be very clear when making bookings online and confirm that you are indeed getting what you pay for! From here on in we had an amazing stay - they were more than helpful on any requests we made, the rooms were more than adequate, the pool was well heated, and I was pleased to have the Balcony I actually booked - what can I say... I like fresh air!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant enough. Careful what you pay!”
Reviews.Author: MaxwellSmart86
Reviews.Content: The pleasant foyer and nice staff are reflective of this hotel. Nothing grand. Nothing over the top. You get what you get. The room is functional and nice, although I must admit the carpet needed replacing +/- updating. The pool isn't the kind of pool to do your laps in- itâ€™s too small for that- but it is nice to have a lazy swim. I would certainly stay here again if I got a good deal (I was fortunate to get this as a secret hotel on Wotif) but the room I had was not worth the prices on the Citigate website. At all. (Perhaps I had an unrenovated room?)

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait for the next visit.”
Reviews.Author: RazerK
Reviews.Content: Booked over the weekend 14-15. Check in was fine. Friendly and fast even we were 3 hours early they still manage to check us in. Level 10. Room is good size. Only down side is a Big red wine make on the carpet. Tolite is clean but not big,bit out dated. Bed is nice and comfortable and not over used like Rockford Syd next to china town. I called room service for tooth brush, and they never came. What's with that!!! Location is great. Only cross the street u can find Chinese food. 5 min to market city and china town. If u go Friday night. U can visit te Chinatown night market. The hotel slipped us a note while we were out. On the note it says we can pay $50 to get late check out at 3pm or for $100 to get a extra night. Only if they can tell us when we check in then I can change the flight. Too late for me to take up the offer Pool is nice. Very warm. Just the right size for the kids and the cold Syd weather. Me and my wife already planing to visit Syd again and stay at Citigate next time.

Reviews.Title: “Decent enough”
Reviews.Author: brownsurfgypsy
Reviews.Content: Describing the Citigate Central in one word I would say it is OK. I have stayed multiple times at the Citigate for business. The lifts are sooo slow, one morning I waited 8 minutes for one of the 3 lifts to come grab me from level 12 (not the highest!) everytime I have waited for the lift it has taken ages, with this in mind I started leaving my room 5 minutes earlier so I wouldn't miss my bus! The breakfast bar is sometimes a bit hit and miss- some mornings it is really nice fresh food and some mornings its a struggle to get anything remotely nice. The toaster is an issue and the bread is always stale. On multiple occasions there have been tour busses come through with loud, rude people who the hotel have trouble catering for on top of their guests who are staying at the hotel. The front stairs are a pain when arriving, as no one has ever been there to assist me with carrying my heavy suitcase up the stairs. The rooms are ok, the plumbing was extremely loud last time I stayed and the carpeted floor is stained pretty bad in some rooms. On one occasion I rang the hotel to ammend a booking and was kept on hold for 10 minutes only to be told i'd have to ring back in half an hour! The staff are generally nice but some of them can be quite rude. I would never stay here if I had a choice but I don't.

Reviews.Title: “1 night with the girls”
Reviews.Author: chuckyJellie
Reviews.Content: Stayed only 1 night. We had two rooms booked. Reception was very efficient. Rooms had two double beds and bathroom on the small size. Pool area on the 8th floor was a good size. You need your room card to access the pool area. We had a hen's night booked at a venue in Oxford Street so the receptionist rang thru and booked a mini bus for us. The breakfast area is downstairs near reception. Very close to Paddy's Markets and Central station. We could have paid extra for late check out what ever time we wanted. Each room has a car space which was included in the price of the room. The hotel ticked all the boxes for what we needed.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious and quiet”
Reviews.Author: newycrystal
Reviews.Content: I just spent 2 nights in a Citigate King room. The room was big. It had a king size bed as well as a sofa. Would definately be suitable for a couple or even a small family. The bathroom was clean and modern. Being so close to Central Station and George street i thought you would hear some trsffic noise but the room was very quiet. The only negative of my stay was that the hotel wanted to charge me $10AUD to remove the minibar.

Reviews.Title: “OMG”
Reviews.Author: AussieBumsSydney
Reviews.Content: This would be our sixth stay at the Citigate Hotel Sydney. Our previous stays were acceptable but our stay on Friday 7/10/11 will be our last. We arrived at 3 pm. I had book two rooms for two couples and found that they had cancelled one of the rooms because they thought that I duplicated the booking. Wouldn't you at least ring to confirm??? The room we were finally given was dirty and not in the best condition. The shower walls were mouldly, the cupboard that had the bar fridge inside had fallen off it's hinges due too water damage, stains on the carpet and to top it off there was a condom wrapper on the floor behind the waste paper bin in the room. There is far better hotel rooms in the city for $200 a night. Think twice....... I have stayed in better backpacker hostels.

Reviews.Title: “Three people, three nights.”
Reviews.Author: George481
Reviews.Content: A very adequate hotel, with no pretensions. Good breakfast, spacious room, and a great location near Paddy's Market, ChinaTown, and Darling Harbour, all in walking distance. (for us , anyway) Good value. Rooms are placed away from the lifts, so very quiet. Agree with Perthmovers previous reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: James B
Reviews.Content: Good location close by to shops and Restaurants. The check in was abit slow but understandable. the price of the hotel was also reasonable!

Reviews.Title: “Second â€œDateâ€� At The Citigate. This Could Get Serious.”
Reviews.Author: PerthMovers
Reviews.Content: Staying at any hotel is a bit like dating, if youâ€™re impressed by your first time, given the opportunity; you hope for a second date, just too make sure that you werenâ€™t taken in by the occasion the first time out. Recently, I had my: â€œsecond dateâ€� at the Citigate Sydney (again for business). This time, I was allocated a room on the 11th floor which overlooked the pool. Thanks too the Sydney winter, bathers were at a premium- apart from a couple of foolhardy children, who splashed away with thermal insulated abandonment, while their frozen fathers watched on with rapidly freezing pride. I have already written a longer review on my first stay titled: â€œAll Business with A Little Pleasure.â€� Therefore I donâ€™t have a great deal to add. The room was clean, the bed very comfortable. And the breakfast is still a match for even the most ardent of single-malt induced hangovers. I have included some photos of the bathroom (which I missed in my last submission). So I am happy to report, â€œdate twoâ€� went well. Nobody slurped their soup. This could get serious!

Reviews.Title: “very centrally located and very professional staff”
Reviews.Author: shalinichandr
Reviews.Content: located right next to the central station, this hotel is right next to china town. other than that its so close to darling harbour, barely 15 mins walk. if one takes a walk from the hotel all the way to sydney harbour on george street, i would say you can feel the pulse of sydney. its a barely 1-2 hrs walk and the lovely shops, eateries, historical buildings are all there. the lovely weekend market at argyl street is also linked to george street. all the fabulous chocolate cafes like max brunner, guylain cafe are all there. breakfast was good enough. the usp was the location. they have a half decent gym and internet is on payment basis.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Dee B
Reviews.Content: Our room was definately not 4 star quality (on some sites it's even described as 4.5 stars!). To me it was more like 3 star at most. Carpet horribly stained and old, rust marks on walls, desk coming away from the wall, tatty cheap sideboard.Tiny bathroom - could barely move about in it. Couldn't relax in the bath as it was stained and had grey patches. We asked for another room but it was even worse. Most rooms look out into what seems to be student high rise flats- interesting if you like observing other peoples' lives at close range. A minority of rooms have a panoramic view. I got the impresison the hotel is just letting its rooms run right down. How it got a 4 star rating I don't know -unless some floors are better than others??

Reviews.Title: “Great For A City Break”
Reviews.Author: Merran97
Reviews.Content: Did not know what to expect but this hotel was a terrific surprise. From the friendly and helpful staff to the rooms which were spacious, clean and very comfortable. The views we had were also a lovely bonus. Breakfast the next morning was delicious and again the staff more than happy to stow our bags on checking out to do some last minute shopping before departing Sydney. We will definitely stay here again. Citigate Hotel? Great !!!

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: bettyluvstravel
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great locating, close to paddys markets, chinatown, entertainment cetntre, monorail and lightrail. Walking distance to darling harbour. Room service fantastic, car parking close by and cheap. Have stayed here many times over the years, and we are always more than happy to return. Rooftop pool great in summer. check in and out prompt.

Reviews.Title: “We Loved it and are going back this year.”
Reviews.Author: Allymal
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a quick weekend getaway. We found it extremely handy to walk to Darling Harbour, Paddys Markets, shopping and other transport options etc. The whole place was so well kept and clean. The pool area is really nice - not huge but enough to cool down on a hot day. The staff were friendly and helpful and the food in the restaurant was great and considering where the hotels is it wasnt too badly priced. They even cooked us food that wasnt on the menu (fussy kids and husband). Also amazingly as you are in the middle of a city there was no noise because the hotel is kind of tucked away in a nice quiet street. Really great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the Money”
Reviews.Author: Janetwren
Reviews.Content: We had a couple of nights at the Citigate and found the beds comfortable and the room clean,although it was a bit in need of renovating with worn carpets and chipped tiles in the bathroom. The location was very handy to China Town and Darling Harbour and plenty of restraunts. The staff were pleasant on arival and departure. Parking some of the cheapest in Sydney All in all an affordable get away in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and great service”
Reviews.Author: LizzyLeeton
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated at the southern end of the city and within easy walk of Central Railway Station. Ideally situated for Paddys Market, Chinatown, Entertainment Centre and George Street. It is not that close to other attractions but the train and buses are nearby. A lot of students frequent the area and there are plenty of cheap places to eat nearby. The hotel has/is being refurbished and the rooms are clean and spacious. Nice lobby and bar area. You can sometimes get cheap parking deals at the parking station next door as well when you book a room. We hvae stayed there two or three times, mainly due to the cheap deals on WOTIF. Great service at the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Outdated room, great shower.”
Reviews.Author: BellaOlive
Reviews.Content: Paid $120 for this room with double queen bed (mystery wotif pick) which is fair value for this room. The poor Citigate is well and truly ready for a make over but in the meantime you can pick up a great sized room in a reasonably good location for a fair price. The description on the mystery pick is "4 and a half star... near Chinatown, Darling Harbour and Cockle Bay". The staff are lovely. We stayed in room 1502 which had an amazing view.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, quick & easy”
Reviews.Author: itchyfins
Reviews.Content: Check-in was very quick and efficient. The room was big and comfortable. Rooms are a little dated, but since I just booked the cheapest, it's not a reflection on the hotel. It was fine, just the carpet was a little stained. The bed was big and comfortable though and pillows = great :) Location is great, only a few minutes walk to Chinatown and about 10-15 to Darling Harbour. Breakfast in the restaurant looked good but my room rate didn't include it, and the room service menu was about $35 for a full breakfast so I didn't eat there.

Reviews.Title: “What a Gem”
Reviews.Author: GrandviewQueensland
Reviews.Content: Not in the most appealing street at this stage with building works across the road. Don't this deter you, it is great value for money in the Sydney CBD. Our room was very clean and comfortable. Room service dinner is very good value, also breakfast downstairs. Loved the pancakes! Staff are friendly and parking didn't cost the earth.

Reviews.Title: “central to everything”
Reviews.Author: rechargedbat
Reviews.Content: Staff were friendly, rooms were very nice and modern. Just left the car while we stayed in Sydney so we had no parking hassles. Great spot will come again

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Chinatown and good value”
Reviews.Author: wombatdavid
Reviews.Content: We booked the mystery deal on wotif and got this hotel (we were pretty sure it was the hotel from the description before we booked!). It was $120 which is cheap for Sydney. The check-in was quick and polite and we were allocated a room on a high floor, as requested, with a King Bed. The corridor is a little off putting as it is very bright and sparse, but the room was fine. It was large with a big TV and a reasonable sized shower (but the bathroom was a bit dated). The TV had a few extra channels but no digital. The bed was comfortable and we enjoyed our stay. We would recommend for the great location in Chinatown - really near to all the shops, bakeries, Market City etc. And easy to get to from Central station.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: EllenorNewcastle
Reviews.Content: My sisters and I booked the Citigate on a TV deal. It was $140 with breakfast and parking. We found this great value. The hotel is in a handy position. We found the staff to be exceptional and the breakfast was one of the better ones I have had. The hotel was very busy but we received excellent service. I have read that people have had trouble with rude staff but we found them to be very friendly and obliging. We stay in Sydney quite a bit and wouldn't hesitate in staying here again, especially at that price.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value - Clean and Comfy”
Reviews.Author: jaqs21
Reviews.Content: Clean and Comfortable, large rooms with two double deds. Location close to China town and with in walking distance to darling harbour.. Parking at a discounted rate.. Hotel is security concious with keys needed in lift and a secuirty guard in lobby after 10pm.. Would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: CanberraCaro
Reviews.Content: Quick one night stay for work conference. Check-in took some time, as we had just arrived on a bus (40+ people waiting to check-in). Still took less than 10 minutes. Room is spacious enough. Nothing can beat the location though. Only a few minutes away from Darling Harbour, and even closer to Central Station. Carpet was fairly stained, but the rest of the room itself was clean, and so was the bathroom. My only problem was the bed - rock hard. I don't mind a firm mattress, but that was a rather uncomfortable night. Otherwise, it was a really decent stay!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: madgely
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd stay at Citigate and we will be back. Easy walking distance to Capitol Theatre where we watched the wonderful "Mary Poppins" production. Our teenage daughters walked to Paddys Market on Saturday afternoon - only a couple of minutes away. Plenty of restaurant and food options close to Citigate or you can dine at their restaurant/bar. We paid for buffet breakfast which was good value - also 24 hour parking in the parking station next door. Only complaint would be the fact that we were woken up at 5am by noisy neighbours which went on for over an hour but once I rang room service they sent Security to speak to the occupants and noise stopped.

Reviews.Title: “Fears Unfounded”
Reviews.Author: TrevorHall
Reviews.Content: I must admit after reading the reviews of so many disgruntled customers, my expectations were low. However, my fears were unfounded. I booked on wotif and snagged a quiet room on 17th floor for $99 plus $20 for overnight parking. Admittedly, it was a business trip, I arrived around 8pm and left the following day at 9am. I failed to read the small print on the wotif reservation and didn't have photo id with me. The check-in lady was officious and snarling but eventually relented. I avoided the $32 breakfast and walked 80m to the Bella Ciao cafe and had srambled eggs on toast plus a juice for $14. I have to agree though, branding it a 4* hotel is pushing it a bit. Still, can't fault the value for $99.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Here! You've Been Warned!”
Reviews.Author: Dreese_Jen
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival we were left standing around for 10 minutes whilst staff busily walked around us doing there 'allocated' jobs. We weren't asked if we could be assisted in any way as the staff looked too nervous to interact with us (as if management had them on surveillance). When we finally we re asked for assistance, every decision or question posed was an effort to answer. The staff had no idea and had to verify all decisions with the duty manager. Check In took approximately 20mins not including the 10 minute wait on arrival. Not a great start to our visit. The other issue experienced was the 2hr Internet Hire. We paid for 2 hrs, logged on for 10 mins and then logged out. Tried to log back in a few hours later to find that our 2 hrs had expired. Approached staff who again had to verify with the duty manager. The duty manager tried to tell us that we'd used our 2hrs. We argued back and forth until I said "Rewind your f@$kin cameras to prove that I'd been sitting at the PC for 2 hrs" Guess what .... I was right! So then instead of giving me another 2 hr Internet Card he said "come and get me when you want to log onto the internet". And ... guess what.... he wasn't available when we needed to use the internet. We were left waiting for up to an hour for the duty manager to log us in. This got worse when the duty manager changed shifts. The Citigate had made an error and ballsed up the remedy and further imposed inconveniences to us (the paying customer). After complaining to the front desk staff about the duty manager, they agreed that the duty manager was incompetent but didn't want to speak out against him. They were all scared of this duty manager. The feeling was evident through out our stay and I wouldn't stay here if it was for free. We've stayed in hotels were staff are multi skilled and go out of there way to assist you even if its not their direct job description. These people had no idea!

Reviews.Title: “great location, clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: gaznic
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night, whilst in sydney on business, great location near darling harbour, short walk to chinatown and george street. The hotel is not a luxurary hotel for the honeymoon, romantic weekend or view of harbour and city lights - but it was clean, comfortable and decent. My husband and I bring our kids to sydney frequently to catch shows, city ambience or shopping and mostly select hotels near to Darling Harbour - I would stay here again. Room 1016 had 2x double beds, mini bar, shower/bath, window outlook to garden below and budildings across, blackout curtains. Access to paid parking next door, busy foyer - felt safe -lots of people coming and going, nice bar area - comfortbale lounge. Good breakfast- small area, basic selections but covered all the neccesities - bacon, eggs, tomato, sausage, fruit, toast, muffins, cerals and juice. I would reccomend this hotel for location and not breaking the bank, it would suit business stay, trip with the kids and anybody else looking for good location. Bookable on wotif for $120

Reviews.Title: “Fairly basic hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: ozrick33Sydney
Reviews.Content: This hotel is rated 4 stars and it probably is - just. The room was fairly clean but pretty basic. The rate was exceptional as we book it as a Mystery hotel" deal. The location is in Chinatown Sydney and so is quite convenient. The service was very good and friendly. The hotel is just looking a bit tired and could do with refurbishment. The bed was not not good, which is pretty important obviously. For one night, no problem. Two nights? No thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Good central hotel”
Reviews.Author: Aeryn
Reviews.Content: Rooms were good. Bathrooms a little dated but clean. Location was good for a business stay. There were plenty of restaurants in walking distance. There is parking underneath (pay).

Reviews.Title: “Nice and handy location”
Reviews.Author: poiter
Reviews.Content: cant beat the location clean rooms if a little dated but well priced considering where it is

Reviews.Title: “All Business with A Little Pleasure”
Reviews.Author: PerthMovers
Reviews.Content: The Citigate hotel is, not the sort of hotel to take the objective of your affections and declare your undying love. The Citigate hotel is, not the sort of hotel youâ€™d pick to celebrate a special occasion. The Citigate hotel is, not the sort hotel youâ€™d pick if you were chasing a luxury escape for the weekend. And to be fair, this isnâ€™t how the hotel markets itself. The Citigate hotel is perfect for the business traveller, or the frazzled tourist, on a one or two night stopover in a big city. Located on the borders of Chinatown- a 10 minute walk from Darling Harbour, and a 20/25 minute walk from the Opera House or the Harbour Bridge. The Citigate hotel is your perfect silent business partner. I spent two nights at the hotel recently. I arrived well before the appointed check in time and my room was ready (this is always a good introduction to any hotel for the first time visitor). Check in was fast and friendly and I was allocated a room on the 16th floor. The room was clean and presentable- however there is an unmistakable â€œpackage tour busâ€� feel to it. The bathroom was small but adequate. It did however have one great advantage over its more high-brow accommodation providers located nearby. When you turned the hot water tap on in the shower, you got hot water (first time) and likewise, with the cold tap. There was no â€œrainforestâ€� shower- head or water-saver device, popular now in most hotels that sees you having to wrestle the thing half to death in order to get wet at all. The shower was the shower. The sink was the sink- and so at infinitumâ€¦ This utilitarian approach to hospitality may be a little agricultural for some, but I found it refreshingly honest. At the Citigate, what you see is what you get! The only meal I ate at the hotel was breakfast, which again, was a hot honest buffet, a mixture of fish and fowl, grains and legumes. Each night I repaired to the hotel bar after a day of business meetings, and I was always greeted by a drink, well-mixed, prepared by a friendly face... Given its location next to Chinatown, which is busy, boisterous and a bit trite. The hotel is relaxed and clam. So what will disappoint you about this hotel? If you arrive expecting a â€œFour Seasonsâ€™ experienceâ€� on the cheap- then you will be disappointed. If you arrive expecting afternoon tea and canapÃ©s at three- then you will be disappointed. If you arrive expecting breathing taking views of Sydney- then you will be disappointed. If you arrive expecting to get what you paid for, then you should leave a happy customer I did!! Would I stay here again? Yes I would (business only)

Reviews.Title: “lousy service plus dated and worn furnishing, but location was ok.”
Reviews.Author: KHfromSydneyinEurope
Reviews.Content: not sure how it got itself a 4 stars rating. it's probably 3 stars at most. located in chinatown which is handy. close to paddys market and darling harbour. nice lobby. checkin was cold but they were busy. the big minus is the missing toiletries, when asked they didn't deliver it.. delivered at the third request! furniture was dated and worn out, don't seem to have regular maintenance put in. carpet need a good clean. heavy soiling visible. overall, would not recommend to anyone. it;s not worth the value for money. for $260 a night, there are better hotels around; this is more like a no frills hotel with price tag bigger than what's on offer.

Reviews.Title: “This is not a 4.5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: MelbourneMontymum
Reviews.Content: Not sure how this got it's star rating - it should be reviewed! We were on the 9th floor, and got a double. The room had 2 x good comfortable beds but was not very large. It was however, clean and comfortable. The bathroom had a bathtub but also had a large hole in the tiles!! The bath was also really dirty and grubby. There were not enough towels for all of us and I had to call to ask them to be sent up. Considering this was meant to be a 4.5 star hotel i was shocked at the standard to be honest - it was more 3 star and NO WHERE near other 4- 5 stars i have stayed at. Choose somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty nice room”
Reviews.Author: Snoopy13132008
Reviews.Content: Good size room, nice amenities, extra pay for carpark and abit pricey

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and central, but not much else.”
Reviews.Author: BFD
Reviews.Content: Stayed her for a couple of nights for business. Resonably comfortable king bedded room, that is starting to look a bit worn. Stains on the carpets, with the bathroom looking its age. Plenty of Asian tourists staying here in large groups, but considering it is at the bottom end of Sydney's Chinatown, not a big surprise. Ate in nearby chinese restaurants each night that I stayed at the hotel, and was surprised how expensive the meals were - and they were nothing special, I would not bother with Dixon Street again. My tip for evening meals - go a bit further to King Street, Newtown. A wide range of meals from all cuisines, for a much better price.

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad.”
Reviews.Author: Nibbles021
Reviews.Content: Citigate central located in the heart of UTS. Surrounded by student accomdation and car parking. Close to china town which was a benefit. I only stayed one night to go to the casino down the road. Really I thought I would get a decent 4 star resort and I got something close to it. Breakfast was expensive and room service is a long wait. There were problems with checkout when i intended on paying using a $100 note for room service and they told me to pay card or get $64 change. Hmm not good for 4 star. I really wouldn't recomend staying here if it is longer than a night or two.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, parking and quiet with it.”
Reviews.Author: Sanddancer01
Reviews.Content: We visited Sydney to attend the Mardi Gras, I booked this hotel online about two weeks before hand and was suprised to find rooms available, located close to Chinatown within easy walking distance to Darling Harbor and central Sydney, if your visiting the rocks, circular quay or the opera house you can walk in half an hour or catch a train or bus within a few minutes of this hotel, Paddys market is also very close by. Easy parking was a bonus, unlike previous reviewers I had no problems with security but I did park on the top floors, parking was $20 for 24 hours which is good value for Sydney. Our room had no views to speak of but it was sapacious and comfortably furnished with everything you would expect, Staff were polite and efficient. Check in and out was eventless, overall no problems with this hotel and I will certainly stay here again when next in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Only one night but service was outstanding and friendly”
Reviews.Author: Uteboy69
Reviews.Content: I was recently in Sydney for 3 weeks with work, because of the last minute descision to send me from Melbourne and the fact that it was Mardis Gras in Sydney meant that I had to change Hotels for one night (the night of the Mardis Gras) because of most of the town being booked out. TIP - If your visiting Sydney over the Mardis Gras period book your accomodation well in advance. The concierge at reception was perhaps one of the most couteous and friendly I have ever met, being Mardis Gras I asked for a late checkout which was handled expertly and with no extra charge. I had been allocated a room with 2 queen beds, and had made arrangements for 2 friends who were marching in the parade itself to spend the night as they could not find appropriate accommodation, I had expected to be charged for the 2 guests and was more than willing to pay this but this was also handled by reception and was no problem for my guests to stay with no extra charge, we were ech given our own entry card and wished a very happy Mardis Gras. The room was modern and it was the most comfortable bed that I had slept in during my 3 week stay in Sydney (four Hotels). The location was close to Central Station and while i admit the view from our room overlooked what I take to be student accommodation, the overlooked buildings did have architectual merrit, I have read some reviews criticising this, but consider this, that the young age of Australia means that many of our buildings have not yet achieved a status to be recognised as beautiful. If this same hotel was as central to Il de France as this hotel is to Sydney and overlooking the same student accomodation it would be considered a quaint advantage and insight into the Parisian lifestyle (just a thought).

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Zitad
Reviews.Content: Just spent one night in Sydney to see Jersey Boys. Chose the Citigate Central because of offer on Getaway-$140 including full buffet breakfast and parking. Arrived at 12-30pm and check-in was efficient, friendly and immediate. Room had twin queen beds-very comfortable, very clean and linen beautifully laundered and room had an interesting view of a multi-storey home unit block- felt like being back in Hong Kong. Being a week day the pool area was deserted and great to have pool area to ourselves-ample fresh towels in pool area for guests. The buffet breakfast was adequate and regularly restocked. Location is close to George street which meant an easy walk to get a bus or train to uptown. Ok, it is not the Hilton, Shangri-La or Swissotel but I have paid three times the price of the Citi-gate to stay in such hotels . Had a beer and buffet dinner at the Sky Tower-you do not go for the food but the spectacular 360 degree views of Sydney- it is a must for first time visitors to Sydney. Midweek the buffet is $64 a person-good value considering it costs $25 per person just to take the lift for the spectaculr views.

Reviews.Title: “Drab hotel”
Reviews.Author: benchickens
Reviews.Content: Hard to believe this claims to be a four-star hotel. Stayed one night for in a standard queen room for business, which was $229- I would not be happy paying that price if I was staying for leisure. Location is ok for transport but not near good shopping, about 500m walk from Central station, next to UTS and on the edge of Chinatown. Rooms are decorated in a 'modern' style, which in this case means drab and lifeless with no flair whatsoever. Bathroom was the worst part - dark (one fluorescent tube above the mirror which provided very little illumination into the shower with the curtain drawn), chipped tiles, stains in the bottom of the bathtub. Soap wrapped in plastic wrap instead of an option of liquid shower gel. Really, this hotel needs to get with the times, see what is offered overseas at this price point, and not rely on its convenient location alone for business. I will choose to stay elsewhere in future.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: cudman
Reviews.Content: We stayed her for 4 nights and really enjoyed our stay. The rooms were very nice and had all the satellite TV stations. Chinatown is right around the corner and Central station is no more than a 6 or 7 minute walk which makes getting around the city very easy. We did not find the staff to be unpleasant as such, but we did not find them overly pleasant either. One example would be that we kept getting messages everytime we turned on our TV offering us discounted breakfast the next morning. We mentioned this to reception and they said that that was fine so we proceeded to the dining area where we were told that they didnt know what we were on about. The girl in the dining area reluctantly rang reception (about 10feet away) to look into it and then told us that it was ok. She didnt seem very happy about it for some reason. There is a small gym on the 8th floor and a small swimming pool and jacuzzi on the 11th (if I remember correctly) Overall a very good hotel and compared to the prices in Sydney it is good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: AussieBumsSydney
Reviews.Content: Highly recommended. Close to the city's main railway hub. China town only 500 meters away for some good food.

Reviews.Title: “Calling this place a nightmare is kind”
Reviews.Author: TheLoudAustralians
Reviews.Content: Well, where do you start? Â I had a crazy idea that it might be nice to take the bride and kids to the cricket and a day spoiling ourselves in town. Â Not if the the Sh*tigate had anything to do with it! Â  To kick things off I called ahead to say we would be half an hour early and would it be ok to check in. "No probs", they say. Â We arrived to be told that the room wasn't ready yet (no big deal so far), so I asked and received the chance of a quick swim and change and we would go off to IMAX while waiting for the room. Â We had a quick dip (5 minutes) but then realised there were no towels. Â Called housekeeping and was told (in an annoyingly manner) that they're really busy. Â End result was no towels for 30 minutes and we missed the movie - goodbye $60. It gets better - - I needed to receive a work call from the US at a specific time. I arranged for everyone to be at the pool for a while and tried to go back to the room but the key failed. Â Missed call - very angry client. - Having a swim in the evening with the kids and was aggressively accused by the 5"1 Duty Manager that we had been throwing rocks over the balcony. Â No gentle questioning, just both barrels. - Our room on the top floor was right under the VERY BRIGHT hotel sign that had a mechanical arm move every 7 minutes. I persisted until 2.30am before I went downstairs to discuss. Â The duty manager apologised as it had caused problems to other people in the room previously (?!) Â He did give me another room but the damage was done. - Our 7am wake up call to get to the cricket on time came at 10am - Papers that we were offered on check in never arrived - I needed to print tickets so asked reception for advice. The solution was one hour Â minimum of Internet time which I took. Â The computer crashed and the printer wasn't working so they sent the same guy that was checking the pool pH levels to fix the printer - no kidding! Â I gave up and went to an Internet cafe but they still charged me for the access. Â Result - 1 hour late to the cricket. I truly believe that all of this could be avoided with an investment in some more trained staff that have a decent attitude and a genuine desire to look after their guests. Â Â I won't be going back beforehand.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable accomodation near Darling Harbour”
Reviews.Author: OverSeaOverLand
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Citigate Central just before the New Year celebrations in Sydney. One of the main appeals of the hotel is the outside pool, handy in the summer. The pool itself is quite compact and also offers a jacuzzi as well. Hotel seemed very popular with families, may just have been the time of year. Hotel room was decent size, good bed, sofa and modern TV. The thing that let the room down was the bathroom. Bathroom definitely needs replacing, looks dated and old. Cracked tiles, cheap fittings. Looks like it may have been put in quick for Olympics in 2000. Staff generally friendly and helpful. Hotel location is just north of Darling Harbour near China Town. 20 minute walk to downtown CBD. 5 minute walk to monorail and 555 free bus taking you downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Great value city hotel”
Reviews.Author: loulou1960
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two days in late December after Christmas. We stayed under the Sydney Weekender promotion, which was excellent value and I didn't feel that any aspect of our stay was compromised by getting this heavily discounted rate. Great staff especially at check in, early check-in and getting a balcony room were not a problem. The room was clean and comfortable with two queen beds, and great blackout curtains. Bathroom was a little bit dated, but clean and well equipped. Didn't hear any noise from street or other guests. Breakfast was good, parking easy on-site, and the pool area, although small, was nice with chairs and a few lounges. Great location one block from Paddy's Market for cheap shopping, and a huge food court area. Excellent value, would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Needs renovation but fast service and quiet”
Reviews.Author: Victorianlad
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well lcoated, as it is only a 250 metre walk from Sydney Terminal (Central) railway station with its efficient rasil link to and from Sydney (Mascot) Airport. Using teh train is preferable to the bus, private car or expensive and dodgy taxi service. As a number of other TA members have claimed, this hotel certainly requires renovation and would not be good value above what I paid via www.hotelclub.com.au of A$179 per night excluding breakfast. The hotel staff member checking us in, Resa, was pleasant and allowed early check-in at 1130. The hotel lifts and corridors were both in excellent condition. The room doors were not noisy which was a bonus. The room, again as others had claimed, had minor staining on its carpet. It had a flat screen, reasonably small television set. The bedside tables had reasonable lighting including bedside lights. The king bed mattresss sagged slightly at one side but this did not affect my sleep quality. Good curtains effectively blocked the light. The main bench in the room had seen better days. A giveaway for the hotel's age (it was formerly the Carlton Crest) was the 30 year old unused phone socket. Annoyingly, there was no in-room compendium so it took me a while to locate the air-conditioing switrch as the setting was initially far too warm. The wardrobe was of a good size and had an iron and irning board. As others have noted, the bathroom was small but the shower over bath worked acceptably. Baths may be out of fashion in typically cost-cutting disguised as radical environmentalism (particularly when eastern Australia is not enjoying heavy rainfall, showing the fallacy of climate change alarmists) but the bath here was welcomed by yours truly. Shampoo and conditioner provided was a reasonable size and of the 'Bliss' brand. The soap was also fit for purpose. An alarm clock is in the room and worked fine. While not in a room facing it, the student accommodation being built on the corner of Quay and Thomas Streets appears, externally at least, to be virtually complete so any noise problems may hopefully be a thing of the past. There appears to be another building being constructed about 30 or 40 metres to the southwest but this did not present any obvious noise problems. My stay was at a weekend so a weekday stay may be needed to properly assess this. Checkout was fast with the clerk not insisting on a room check (thank goodness.) Owner Mirvac Ltd should make a business decision to renovate the rooms as the time for this is now, not in five years' time. The rate on www.wotif.com and other sites increased substantially closer to my syat although of course this may merely reflect that it was a fairly busy time just prior to Christmas. A Sunday night in June or July may have far lower occupancy.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, okay hotel”
Reviews.Author: beach_bb
Reviews.Content: I think the stars standard defers between Australia and North America. This hotel was not a Westin or W. One notable difference, no porters to help us take our luggage up, self-serve. The hotel was not exactly CBD but it was centrally located and fairly close. We were able to walk nearly everywhere, and public transport (bus, train) was just around the corner. The room was small-ish (coming from North American, everything seemed a bit more cramped) clean and functional but I agree with other posters that it maybe considered dated. We didn't spend too much time in the room or hotel so it didn't matter. The room was quiet and we were able to sleep through the night. One gripe was that internet usage was extremely pricey. This was true throughout the areas we visited in Australia actually. I personally found the staff helpful and courteous. We had an issue with our arranged transfers to the airport, and they assisted in the matter. Finaly, our room package also came with daily breakfast which were a fairly good value for the nice buffet spread. I would recommend this hotel to friends if they were able to find a reasonable deal.

Reviews.Title: “Clean & quiet accommodation.”
Reviews.Author: mimistella
Reviews.Content: Recently spent one night at this hotel and was satisfied with my choice! Firstly, may I just say that I got a cheaper rate on 'wotif' which included full buffet breakfast for 2 & parking. Reception staff very efficient, courteous and cheerful. Breakfast was very good with plenty of hot food, pastries etc and definately value for money! Parking was just that....can't fault parking. Room was quiet and spotless. However, there was a shower curtain over the bath and I did not like that aspect. Also bed mattress was a bit hard but that is probably due to my own preferences and no fault of the hotel. All in all this is a good, clean hotel with a terrific buffet breakfast and pleasant staff. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “OK if you can get a good price”
Reviews.Author: Nat1977
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Citigate Central for 2 nights in early November. We got a really good deal through Wotif (it was one of their Mystery Deals where you don't know the name of the hotel until you've booked) and this hotel is fine for the money we paid. However, if I'd have paid their basic rate, I wouldn't have been very impressed. The rooms are OK but could do with refreshing and updating. The bathroom especially needed a lot of work doing to it. It was very dated and there was a lot of water damage to part of the door and the door frame and it just looked tired and scruffy. The bedroom carpet had a huge pink stain on it and the room just needs a bit of a 'freshen up'. The walls between the rooms are also very thin and so if you're next to someone a little bit loud, you'll be able to hear them really clearly. However, the bed and pillows were nice and comfy, the hotel is in a convenient location for the train station, China Town and Darling Harbour and the room we had was a nice size. The restaurant also looked nice and seemed to have food at a reasonable price (although we didn't dine there). They were also happy to store our luggage for us as our flight back to the UK wasn't until late afternoon. All things considered, an OK hotel, especially if you can get it for a good price. But there are so many other options in Sydney, we won't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Staff”
Reviews.Author: immax101
Reviews.Content: We arrived at this hotel and were immediately greeted by a warm, friendly and efficient staff...and it didn't end there. Whenever we asked fpr anything, needed anything changed or needed help with anything at all - they were more than happy to oblige and were prompt about it - some of the best hoel staff I've come across in quite a while! The hotel room was fairly spacious for the cost and the outdoor pool was perfectly heated and placed for those afternoon drinks by the pool before dinner! I would definitely recommend this hotel for anyone needing something middle of the range - it is well placed in the centre of the city - very close to central station for the trains and buses, well placed for shopping and close to bars and restaurants... A great stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: travelniving
