Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel many years ago when it was Carlton Crest and the condition and service were excellent. I just returned from Sydney a week ago and had a terrible experince this time. I booked the hotel through Wotif at nearly $200 a night with buffet breakfast at this presumably 4-star hotel. We arrived at the hotel at about 2pm and were greeted at arrival by this extremely rude and non-interested employee by the name of Maria. My husband introduced himself but she ignored him the whole time we were there and expressed a greeting to the hotel Citigate without even making eye contact with either my husband or I. She then asked for photo ID and my husband produced his driver's license, but she responded curtly "Not yours, the booking is in her name." At no time was she friendly, cordial or welcoming and on receiving our room keys, she failed to hand back the driver's license and credit card to me but merely placed the credit card on the desk and the driver's license was not handed back until some time later after we realised on entering our room that I ddin't have it in my possession. I subsequently had to return to reception to reclaim my driver's license. The room allocated had significant staining on the carpet and did not have a room safe as promised when we made the booking. Internet is not free and is expensive. I will not stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location. Spacious rooms. Let down by poor hygiene and lack of maintenance. More a 3 star experience.”
Reviews.Author: fastcaral
Reviews.Content: Only stayed for 3 nights on a business / pleasure trip. Reception staff efficient, but not very welcoming. Room was a disappointment. A good size room with 2 queen beds. One was relatively new and firm, the other obviously quite old as it sagged in the middle. Bathroom not cleaned properly as found pubic hairs in the bath. Nasty crack in the sink that looked quite old. Hot water was a problem as the tap had to be turned several times to get any hot water and the pipes moaned loudly. Shower rose was initially spraying water everywhere and ended up breaking off completely. Hotel restaurant was quite good but chef completely stuffed up one of our mains. This meant that I ate my entire main whilst my wife waited for the chef to make another meal for her. They did give us a complimentary drink to make up for it, though. Wouldn't go back or recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Handy to the station,comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Pecky27
Reviews.Content: As we travel. By train it was nearby the railway so convenient for us. It as at the other side of Sydney city, but the transport in syfdney is good. Rooms are bright and comfy with full servicing. Good restaurant , car parking and business centre. Recommended ok

Reviews.Title: “Good value!”
Reviews.Author: RachaelShort
Reviews.Content: The staff were friendly and helpful however the carpet was stained and there was some tiles missing in the bathroom. Excellent food and good value. Nightly special fantastic! Central location. Outdated bathroom facilities. Very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, nice & quiet.”
Reviews.Author: shae0
Reviews.Content: Clean spacious rooms, comfortable beds. Loved the pool,good temperature. Great buffet breakfast,lots of variety. The hotel held our luggage after we had checked out so that we could see the sights. Very close to Chinatown and Darling Harbour and the train station. After a day sight seeing, it was good to go back to somewhere peaceful, ordered a coffee and it came with a large glass of iced water, nice added touch. will come back soon. Only negative was that we had to lug our bags up the stairs, needs a lift or a ramp.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, family friendly”
Reviews.Author: JohnfromCaloundra
Reviews.Content: Just got back from our stay here, and had a nice time. Rooms are quite spacious. If you are looking for awesome views from your hotel , this is not the place. If you are looking for a central, well priced location, close to the city/chinatown/darling harbour/public transport...this is your place. Staff quite nice, and facilities are good ( gym/pool) . All in all, very good!

Reviews.Title: “AVERAGE”
Reviews.Author: TAMMI_TOASTI
Reviews.Content: Two of three reception staff not helpfulL! No valet service offered for luggage - We were only told where luggage racks were. Room maintenance required air conditioning not working properly. We requested a king room and were given a queen. Breakfast in the restaurant was good and all the restaurant staff were helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad but not stunning”
Reviews.Author: dooragan
Reviews.Content: Pretty reasonable hotel in an area undergoing renewal. Not quite in the heart of things, this 3.5-4 star hotel is on the edge of Sydney closer to Ultimo than it is to Chinatown. The area is a little seedy but lots of new buildings underway. A 10 minute walk from Central Station, it is close to all the major bus lanes and you can be at Circular Quay quite quickly (a 25 minute walk otherwise). I was there for business so didn't use the car park, gym or pool so can't comment on these. The restaurant was really good for dinner and has a very good, comprehensive buffet breakfast which would please anyone. Ambiance in the lobby and restaurants was OK and service very good. The rooms though felt very sterile even though the room I had was large and well equipped with a king size bed, sofa, work desk, flat screen TV etc. Stark white walls would have benefited by a picture or two. I was on the 18th floor so the room was quite quiet - although no real views to speak of. Room service was very good...fast service and good food at reasonable cost. Overall, this is a good choice if you really want to be up this end of town and practically on the edge of the CBD. It is close to Chinatown and the UTS. Personally, I think there are much better choices closer to the heart of the city but at least the Citigate is close to most transport options.

Reviews.Title: “Service at front desk very poor.”
Reviews.Author: papas1983
Reviews.Content: It would have been nice to know that the building next door had construction happening to it, as it was jack hammers, cement trucks, very muddy and a lot of noise. Upon arrival there where lots of stairs to climb with our luggage, there was no ramp and no conceige at the door. Front desk was just as bad, 2 very rude people at front desk who check you in while also answering calls at the same time. Room was average, bathroom in desperate need of renovation. Bed linen in need of face lift. Dont bother watching movies on the TV as the picture is narrow and you cant see the movie. Dont bother with breakfast as it is very expensive and when you receive it, it is cold dry hard toast for $19.50. There are much better 4 and half star accomodations in Sydney. Very over rated and what you see in the adds for this accomodation is not at all what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location but hotel needs maintenance”
Reviews.Author: Skozzie
Reviews.Content: The hotel has an excellent location, only 2 minutes walk to central station, less than 1 minute to Paddys Market and Chinatown. Chinatown is full of amazing asian restaurants and food courts where we did most of our eating. Check-in was a bit disappointing, the check-in girl checked us in whilst on the phone the entire time, obviously good at multi tasking, but as for customer service not a good first impression. The hotel rooms are a nice size, we had 2 firm queen beds, 2 chairs, an office chair and small table...with more than enough space to move around in. Sadly our bathroom was not up to standard, the shower over bath constantly leaked which has marked the bath surface so badly that is chipping away. I would lay towels in the bath at night to stop the dripping sound. By morning 2 towels were soaked.... thats a lot of water wastage! I would expect better bathroom amenities from a 4* hotel, a bit of moisturising lotion would be appreciated. The rooms just need a good clean, the carpet is stained, the desk area was sticky and had cup ring stains on it, nothing a good clean couldnt fix between guests. THe mini bar fridge was broken, there were wires lying in the fridge, didnt affect us as we were not going to pay AUD7.00 for a small bottle of water! For a city hotel, I did find the rooms nice and quiet and didnt hear much of the street noise. THe breakfasts were good, a nice variety without the mass produced feel that some of the bigger hotels have. We stayded 3 nights, and prepaid for our breakfast, each morning our names were not on the breakfast list, by the 3rd morning we felt a little embarassed to be harassed at the restaurant reception that we did not have breakfast included and had to pay for breakfast, after checking with reception they also said we did not have breakfast included.... at check out I showed my confirmation including breakfast, am hoping I dont find an additional charge on my credit card for the "additional breakfasts". To sum up an average hotel , I did book directly with the hotel and probably paid slightly more than than what WOTIF sells the rooms for..... if you are after a good location, and can get the hotel for a good price its worth it.... although there is better out there.

Reviews.Title: “A very slow hotel”
Reviews.Author: trevar
Reviews.Content: On the surface, this is a clean hotel, with decent service, comfortable beds and good facilities. A short stay soon reveals its flaws, though. I ordered room service at what was obviously a busy time. The person who took my order apologised that I would have to wait 40 minutes. 90 minutes later I rang back, found the order unfilled, and cancelled it. Luckily it wasn't much of a walk to find a late night takeaway. The broadband was equally disappointing; it was frightfully slow and at times just stopped, just like the room service! And if that wasn't enough, the lifts were also extremely slow, and just as prone to stopping. Of the three lifts, only two were ever working at one time during my two night stay, and sometimes only one was functioning. Using the stairs to go down from the eleventh floor was equally frustrating, as the ground floor is not marked from the stairwell, and I found myself (along with a few other guests) interrupting a school excursion when we found ourselves on the lower ground floor instead. I also had to leave extra time in the morning for ironing, as the iron is the steamless variety and wasn't particularly useful. The catering is reasonable. Mushrooms marked as 'eggs' isn't a big problem, but it reflects the general atmosphere in the restaurant. On some fronts, this hotel is better than many, but some of these problems were particularly frustrating, and overall, I just found myself running around the whole time trying to make up for lost time.

Reviews.Title: “Neat and Clean but location not very good.”
Reviews.Author: YPAL
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my wife and daughter on 3rd and 4th Jul'10. Due to delay in flight , reached hotel at 11:55 PM in the night. The lady at reception was not friendly, rather rude. The room was large enough, neat and clean. Linens were also neat. Day time reception staff was nice nad helpful. We had buffet breakfast, whihc had variety. The location of the hotel is not good. It is in the china town. The tourist attractions are away. Yashpal ypdot@sify.com

Reviews.Title: “Good value for what we paid”
Reviews.Author: GC10Glen
Reviews.Content: We read the tripadvisor reviews before we booked in, and all was true: there was a concierge on only 1 of the 3 days of our stay (not the day we struggled up the entrance stairs with our heavy bags), we got the room with the cabinet water damage (under the fridge), BUT: * for $120 per night (wotif mystery deal) you will struggle to find better value in such a location * it IS close to Central Station, Paddy's Market, Chinatown, Darling Harbour, Light Rail etc etc * our room was very spacious * I will stay here again at this rate * some construction works happening in the adjacent area * the refurbished, heated pool is nice * Staff were friendly

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ginger1976
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one week in February , rooms were very spacious and clean. I also paid for breakfast before I went there which I'm glad I did, there was lots of choice and the food was freshly cooked. The staff in the restaurant were very pleasant. We had an evening meal here one night too, one of the nicest meals the whole time I was in Australia. The hotel is just near Cockle Bay Wharf where there are lots of restaurants and you can take a ferry round to Circular Quay from here. Or if you go the opposite way down George Street, you will end up in CQ that way. The pool was clean here only criticism would be it is small and any more than 2 people in there and it is overcrowded., only used jacuzzi once but that was nice, just not very warm. No complaints at all and I would recommend staying here whilst in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Only just ok..”
Reviews.Author: 0418jan
Reviews.Content: No one there to help us with luggage for a family of 4, until we almost finished carrying it all up the front stairs ourselves. The reception staf f, who i know looked up at us at the front doors with luggage. Three of them looking down at something, the lady in the middle,,(short with dark hair pulled back) of three of them, finally looked up , she had attitude. Then after the painful checkin was complete i saw the three of them blantantly talking about us. Very professional....NOT. The plates for breakfast Buffet had food on 3 out of 5 of them. I noticed alot of people didn't seem to care. But I did. Housekeeping did what i asked ..they were great. Reception stinks.All because of HER. So that's done it for me. My sister stays there alot for the bank she works for, hence our decision to stay there.My Daughter was so upset that they were pointing and talking about us that she wanted to leave straight way. She is only 8.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed our stay.”
Reviews.Author: Linzjen
Reviews.Content: A friend and I bought our night's accommodation as a Wotif secret special. We had a great time from the moment we arrived. Reception staff were very pleasant, and our twin queen bed room was clean and comfortable. Favourite moment was having a swim in the heated pool and spa at night with the lights of the city around us. Even the other guests at this hotel were friendly - thank you to the nice young man who helped us open a stubborn bottle! Breakfast in the restaurant was delicious, and staff could not be more helpful. My friend loved the mini muffins! We payed a bargain price for this hotel stay, but enjoyed a four star experience instead.

Reviews.Title: “Good location. Not a 4.5 star hotel though.”
Reviews.Author: MagpieJB
Reviews.Content: I'll keep it brief. Not too bad if you get it for a cheap Wotif rate like we did. If I paid any more than that I'd be pretty annoyed. I'm not really sure how they can claim it as 4.5 star. The rooms are spacious but old, dirty and in need of a refurbishment. No fans in the bathroom and there is water damage and mould everywhere. Finishings are all rotten and cracked and the carpet is dirty. The location is excellent. Across the road from Central train station. All up it's not too bad as long as you don't pay more than a heavily discounted rate. It's about 3 - 3.5 star.

Reviews.Title: “if respect and good customer service is what your after - AVOID 100%!”
Reviews.Author: jackkkkk
Reviews.Content: I booked a few rooms with friends for a night out in the town. We chose this hotel as it was close to star city, and that was where we were heading! Check in was woeful. Maria didn't offer a smile and barely said two words other than 'Can I have your credit card' and 'I need a license too'. It was disgraceful. Our keys were then just thrusted under our nose and we were sent on our way. I asked where the elevators were, and she just glared and pointed. How this woman still has a job is beyond me! There have been many bad reviews about her service, but they seem to magically 'disappear' from the site! When we got to our rooms, I rang reception and spoke to Tammy who confirmed that the rest of our party was staying in the rooms next door. When they arrived at the hotel, they were not only placed in a room 5 floors up, but in a room with a king bed, when we clearly booked 2 queens. I went to reception to sort out the problem, and Tammy was there. She flat out lied and told the manager that she never even spoke to us. I was absolutely gobsmacked. We were offered a rollaway bed, but for the price of $210, I dont think its fair to expect someone to sleep on a rollaway bed. Despite the disgusting service and attitude from Tammy and Maria, there were some staff that were actually nice. Nick from reception was very friendly and helpful, and Belle from the bar was FANTASTIC! Very friendly and helpful. After our stay we were emailed a survey to complete, and when our problems were noted, all we received was some pathetic, generic response from the manager. Its as if they don't care about their guests at all. Besides the terrible service, the rooms aren't half bad, but the bathrooms definitely need an upgrade. Room service was quick and tasty, but overpriced. All in all, i would NEVER return here, and advise everyone to do the same.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible trip, awful stay”
Reviews.Author: benny1486
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff lost one of our bags, and we discovered they had "misplaced it" by giving it to another person leaving the hotel. In the time that the hotel had "possession" of our bag (although its hard to know how long it left the hotel for), valuable items were stolen from the bag. The hotels response at the time was lazy and inept, providing us with little information about what was going on, and took them nearly an hour into the ordeal to even apologise. We missed our bus home because of their incompetency, and then when they gave us cash to catch another bus, they didn't give us enough. The most offensive aspect of this trial, was that when we asked if we would be compensated for the items lost, when the hotel gave our bag to a completely different person, we got a cold response of "no we are not liable". They may as well left our luggage out in the street, to be plundered - and if they had done this, they apparently still wouldn't have any liability. This may be a typical stance of many hotels, but considering that Citigate actually gave our bag to another person, and then poorly managed the situation was enough to convince my partner and I that this hotel is worthy of 0 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service and great value”
Reviews.Author: Puddle88
Reviews.Content: Very obliging staff, nothing was too much trouble. On check out, before I even got a chance to ask, a staff member had checked if I needed any storage for my luggage for the day, and whether I would be needing an airport transfer. Both of which I needed, and probably would have had to ask about anyway, but it was nice that they were proactive and obliging to help. Booked through wotif as a mystery deal, and couldn't be happier with both the price and the service. The hotel is also situated in a great location, a little walk from the CBD heart, but very accessable and I felt very safe walking around the area. I would definately visit again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and location”
Reviews.Author: Abbey_8
Reviews.Content: Stayed with partner and it was a great hotel. Beds and quiet surroundings excellent considering location of Haymarket. It was actually in a very quiet and safe area just a 2 minute walk to Central Station. About a 10 minute walk to Town Hall Station. Breakfast was very good clean good selection. Cappacinos were extra (only $3) but the staff were upfront and the coffee was well worth it. (regular coffee from percolator available for free) Given the taste of the food from the restaurant I am disappointed that I didn't try dinner. For the price this was a bargain, bathrooms a little tired but for the price who cares, the beds, TV, staff, breakfast and location all fabulous. I would stay here again. Walked home at 11pm from the station safe area loved it. Staff were fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in handy location”
Reviews.Author: sangasori
Reviews.Content: We stayed overnight in a Kingbed room on the sixteenth floor.The room was clean,comfortable,spacious and everything worked well.The front office staff were very helpful and friendly.The breakfast,although pricey, was delicious.Free parking was included as part of our Wotif package and the location is just a few minutes walk to chinatown and The Entertainment Centre.Would definately stay here again and recommend it to anyone wanting a centrally located hotel.

Reviews.Title: “incredibly short stay -”
Reviews.Author: traveloctopus
Reviews.Content: due to an already tight schedule being blown out by flight dramas, ended up only checking in approx 1am, and checking out at about 5.30am. a pity though, as i liked what i saw of the hotel. friendly staff, well designed high level room with a great view. slight issues with air con, but otherwise everything was great. on trips like this, it is great to stay at a professional hotel to offset everything else.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Falcey
Reviews.Content: Stayed overnight after seeing Wicked nearby. The room had a functional feel but was very quiet, clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Good central hotel”
Reviews.Author: fentiger1935
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night at the end of a cruise before flying home.Our room was large, 2 queen size beds and a full bathroom, it was available at 10am. There was a free breakfast, buffet style with plenty to choose from. We were just down the road from Paddys Market with the monorail close by A$9.95 hop on hop off all day. Darling harbour is a short walk away, lots of restaurants in this area. The only downside (small)was the steep steps to get in and out of the hotel, I believe there was wheelchair access via the carpark.

Reviews.Title: “expected worse”
Reviews.Author: balitribe
Reviews.Content: this hotel has had some fairly tough reviews so I wasn't sure what to expect! Other than the fact the bathrooms are small & dated this hotel was very good. Rooms are spacious and modern. I couldn't really fault it for the price we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Great location .. but”
Reviews.Author: globalbaker
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights on business in Sydney. Firslty, the staff were very pleasant and helpful and the beds were fantastic. The location is very central for walking to the convention centre, paddys market and Chinatown. My allocated room had a problem with a noise coming from a pipe above the ceiling which sounded like a running tap all night. On request, on the second night of not being able to sleep I was given a change of room. The second room was on the same floor as the pool ( which was closed for repairs), and the hallway stank of damp mouldy carpet. The food in the restaurant was pretty ordinary and there are lots of better option nearby. Overall I would stay here again if the price was right as it is so centrally located, the staff were helpful and the beds were great.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: undertaker01
Reviews.Content: Adequate hotel, large rooms, beds a little hard, but fine, personnel nice & some very helpful, charge for internet ridiculous, was not even available last night there, restaurant a little pricey. Our room had spots on rugs, shower was uncomfortable because goes hot & cold while on, without touching the faucets. Canâ€™t get a free cup of coffee in AM. Location next to Chinatown a bonus. Very long walk to Harbor, easy walk to Central Station, (buy daily pass, includes tram, buses & ferries) which will get you anywhere. Rooftop Jacuzzi & pool a plus.

Reviews.Title: “Only stay if you need the UTS, otherwise forget it !!”
Reviews.Author: HolidayLover006
Reviews.Content: My daughter attended a weekend course at the UTS on Broadway, so this hotel seemed to be the closest and looked the nicest after a researching what was around. We checked in on Friday about 6pm after a 2.5 hour drive. Our room was small, very dated and very shabby. The furniture had been knocked around and had definitely seen better days. The carpet was very badly stained all over and was very wet ????? assumed they must have just shampooed the carpet, but have no explanation for this. Beds were ok. I rang housekeeping for more pillows and they were promptly delivered. I did read later there was a pillow menu, but I was not informed of this when I rang. Breakfast was included in our package and was a pretty standard hotel brekky. Saturday night we ate in at the restaurant. The food was very ordinary. We ordered garlic & cheese bread for a starter and we received two parbake rolls with garlic butter on them. For main my daughter had a chicken pasta, which was bland and tasteless, she only ate half as she said it was making her feel sick. I ordered fish and chips which was quite nice. Unfortunately we had some partyers on our floor who got in at about 3.30am and obviously coudn't remember which rooms they were in, 'cos they tried to get into ours with their swipe card many, many times. After much yahooing up and down the hallway and the whole key thing, I rang down to the front desk at about 5am and security came and quietened them down - not the hotels fault, I realize. On Sunday morning, cleaning staff TWICE opened our door, saw us there and apologized and told us they would come back later - why, I don't know as we were checking out that day, so our room should not have been serviced anyway. I ended up putting a 'PRIVACY PLEASE' hanger on my door. I checked out the pool area, much smaller than on the website, obviously taken from the 'right' angle - also very windy as it is on the 8th floor. All in all, a dissappointment and we won't be back. If she has to attend the UTS again, I would look at the Mercure or the Medina.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - Great Beds - Quiet Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Michele2909
Reviews.Content: I have never stayed in a hotel where there is no noise. Didn't hear any road traffic, no other bathrooms, no lifts - was fantastic and we stayed there on a night when there was a big rock concert in town and lots of concert goers coming in late and in party mode. Room was large compared to many and the value (booked way in advance) was great. Two queen beds and very comfortable. Bathroom aging, but rest of hotel looks recently refurbished. Staff friendly and obliging. Walking distance to Central Station, Entertainment Centre, China Town - very central.

Reviews.Title: “quality stay”
Reviews.Author: mummyL
Reviews.Content: my husband and i stayed just 1 night to see a show nearby. the room was big enough and bright, clean, and with a small balcony. the bathroom was a little old, but eberything worked. room service came quickly and easily. the ppol was very small, and on a hot day like we had, could not get near it for the people. the restaurant and bar downstairs was very convenient, very good breakfast. the staff were fine, did not go out of their way to help, but were pleasant enough. a nice easy walk from here to the markets, chinatown and darling harbour.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad but not the best”
Reviews.Author: Becz-Awa
Reviews.Content: We discovered on arrival that we couldn't check into our room after a 9 hour flight until 2pm - it was only 9.30am!! I had even requested an early check in time but they still wouldn't let us check in. They did allow us to leave our luggage there while we left to see the sights of Sydney (the last thing you want to do after a 9 hour flight!). The staff were friendly enough but their service wasn't much to rave about. I didn't use the gym but had a look at it and it looked quite good, so did the swimming pool. Our room was a good size, clean and had a comfortable bed. The view was of other buildings. The bathroom was tiny & a bit run down. We looked at the room service menu & then put it back down again as it was really overpriced. The location isn't too bad though for places to eat at night (instead of the expensive hotel) but it is quite far from the harbour. Overall not too bad but I've stayed in better hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Sooooo overpriced...nice staff, otherwise a rip off”
Reviews.Author: luciaandwills
Reviews.Content: I've just come back from one night at the Citigate, where I paid - wait for it - $274, through wotif for one night. In fairness I'll put in the good stuff first - 11am checkout, really, really nice staff who were more helpful and friendly than most places, and a wide, comfortable bed. I got there after a long flight, totally exhausted and ready to sleep, which is why I booked a good hotel as a treat. The staff helped with my bags and were super-nice. But now the kicker. The room I stayed in was circa 1990, and showing a lot of wear and tear as a result - stained laminex, bath, grouting and basin. This isn't the end of the world - I don't mind not getting the 5 star treatment, but I do mind when I'm paying that much. The hotel is in a kind of dodgy part of the city, so all night there was yelling and squealing from the alley downstairs which woke me up every 20 minutes or so - poor soundproofing on the windows if any at all. Then, from 3 in the morning, all the partygoers coming back to our floor woke me up...no soundproofing on the door. I'm not a light sleeper in that state, so this is a pretty big achievement. Finally at 5 30am a drunk, angry guest started beating on the door next to mine and yelling, which again woke me up and also freaked the hell out of me. I called reception - who were very nice - and tried to go back to sleep.Took a while - the people were arguing. Now, obviously the hotel can't control whether people make noise in the alley or corridor, but it's equally obvious that it's going to happen and what's the point of a hotel if you cant sleep in it? This is a Mirvac Hotel, just like the Sebel, which is my Sydney favourite and costs half as much, and Mirvac should know a lot better than to charge that much for such a poor product. Frankly, I'd like my money back.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel in central Sydneyâ€Ž”
Reviews.Author: thommo177
Reviews.Content: We were a bit worried by some of the poor reviews but decided to try it anyway. Parking our car in the adjacent carpark was easy, and the $23 cost for 24 hours parking seemed very reasonable for the Sydney CBD. No hassles at all with our booking & the check-in/ check out: staff were efficient & friendly. The reception area was spacious & pleasant and the three main lifts worked well. The corridors and our room were spotlessly clean with seemingly newish carpets & paint. Our room on the 17th floor had great views across the Anzac Bridge & beyond. It was surprisingly spacious, the king-size bed very comfortable, and the TV, lights, iron, fridge & air-con (on a 36C day!) all worked fine. We had a very good night's sleep despite the low rumbling of the air-con which is almost always present in these sort of big hotels. Bathroom was a bit small and a little dated but it had everything you need & was spotlessly clean. Room service was rather pricey, but as the hotel is in a great location (very close to public transport and with heaps of cafes & great little asian restaurants nearby) that really wasn't a problem. We got a very good deal through wotif, and after our stay there Citigate seems like amazing value, especially when compared with some of the cramped, run-down & hugely overpriced hotels we stayed in in Europe last year. Only thing we didn't like was the doona on the bed, which we promptly chucked off & replaced with the blanket we found in the closet (why oh why have they done away with blankets in the name of "smartness"? - these stupid over-hot doonas are everywhere now). In summary, Citigate is highly recommended if you want real value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Very poor service”
Reviews.Author: ncfc18
Reviews.Content: I booked Citigate because it was a big name hotel and it was in Sydney's CBD near public transport. I was traveling with my cousin so I booked a double room - meaning it should contain 2 beds. When I arrived at the hotel I was told I would need to give a credit card or a $100 a night safety deposit despite the fact I had already paid in full. I was given no notice of this, even when I called up the day before to ask if I needed anything. After arguing with a very rude staff member I was given my key and when I went into the room to find there was only one bed. I went back to reception and I was told all the double rooms were booked out. I was not told this when I made the booking and was charged for the double room. I was not even told when I was given the key. After much more arguing I was somehow put into an empty double room, I was not offered any concession, not even a free meal at the restaurant. The hair-dryer and bath/shower in the room were old and of very poor quality and the staff were very unhelpful and rather rude. The only good thing about this hotel was the proximity to central station. I will definitely not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good rooms, decent location, woeful bathrooms”
Reviews.Author: orangestreet
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights over the Christmas period (close to the New Year). Will not be staying at this hotel again. The actual rooms are excellent and refurbished (1600 series). The bathroom was appalling. The so-called outdoor pool is tiny and crowded and very unappealing. Somebody put some salts in it when were there and there was froth all over the place. This is a 3.5 star hotel at best. If you can manage a great deal in one of the last minute deal websites for less than $100 and donâ€™t really care about where you are staying as long as it is reasonably comfortable then you are in business. The hotel has some features going for it though. The location with regards to proximity to public transport cannot be faulted. Plenty of cheap eats at Chinatown nearby and Darling Harbour is a short stroll away. The actual rooms are very good and some excellent views can be had from floors higher up. Pity about the pool and those terrible bathrooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: advocate_of_truth
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel, after managing to get an exceptional deal! The hotel is very ideally located near Chinatown and Darling Harbour. The rooms are spacious and clean. Pros: Quiet location Very conveniently located (5 minute walk from Market City and Chinatown) Nice spacious rooms Good value Great Friendly service from staff Cons: Carpets in rooms could do with a make over Too many sports cable channels

Reviews.Title: “Exellent stay”
Reviews.Author: purplevw13
Reviews.Content: Easy to find, close to everything, good rooms, great buffet breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Andy085
Reviews.Content: I travelled to sydney recently and stayed in the citygate, I found the service at the front desk really great and the staff were always pleasent and willing to help in anyway they could. When i got there my Airline had mixed up my bags so i had no clothes, the staf said they would take what bags i had 2 the room and then pointed me in the right direction...not that i had to walk far as the Citygate is very near central and george st...also Chinatown and Paddys markets so i was spoilt for choice! The room wasnt amazing but very big and spacious with everything needed for a modest hotel i would advertise it at 3 star if they didnt have the rooftop pool The 1 thing that i could complain about was the fact they advertised broadband in the rooms and there wasnt any, when i asked about it they sold me a card that was $10 for an hour, but u cant use it for 5 and still have 55mins left...it was literally for that hour so i ended up paying $10 for 5mins internet...other than that though i thought it was excellent and would stay there again. I would recommend staying here if you want good service and a roof over your head while you look around the city..DONT stay here if u want views of the oprea house and harbour and expect your poodle to have spa treatments everyday...in fact if your 1 of those people please dont come to Australia at all!!

Reviews.Title: “better than our expectation”
Reviews.Author: stevani
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel thru agoda, deluxe room 4 nights. We arrived at the hotel morning around 7.30, only 6 minutes check in process we got our room ready, the receptionist was very friendly. Our room no. was 1816 facing UTS. The room is big, clean, and look new ! Location is super, hotel staff is helpful too showing us how to go around the city. We love it and will stay again if we have chance to visit sydney again.

Reviews.Title: “great location, reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: callchee
Reviews.Content: great location - short walk to china town, darling harbour and central station.

Reviews.Title: “It was the worst weekend”
Reviews.Author: millster123
Reviews.Content: I booked this trip as a suprise for my very pregnant sister. We had tickets to a concert so I picked this hotel because 1. It was close to the entertainment centre and 2. there was a parking garage attached to the hotel. When we arrive at approx 3pm we went up to our room and the room had not been made up, sheets still messed up from last guest , towels on the floor and ironing board in the middle of the room. We were then given a new room. After returning back from the concert late we got a phone cal at 455am and when I answered it was the hotels hold music. When I checked out a day early and told the reception staff about this they just said " thats weird" Then after paying an arm and a leg for parking I returned to my car to find it had been broken into. I have to say circumstances spoilt this weekend but the hotel did not make it any better.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location and rooms”
Reviews.Author: Saraogi
Reviews.Content: Date 15th June We stayed at The Citigate Central at Sydney from May 11th till May 16th and we had a great experience. Excellently located, just 10 minutes walking distance from Darling Harbour the hotel was fantastic. We arrived at 7.30 am and the hotel gave us an early check in at no extra charge, which was very sweet of them. The rooms were great with 2 queen size beds and three of (my wife, daughter and I) were extremely comfortable. The food was great and the breakfast spread was amazing. The staff were very helpful and couteous at all times. I reccommend all Indians to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room, fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: hot101
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed here in recently and were very pleased. We stayed in the Harbour View Executive suite on the top floor. Its one of 2 rooms that has a balcony. The room wasnt as big as I thought it would be but very modern and clean. The King size bed was the most comfortable bed Ive slept in for years. There were lovely soft robes hanging up for us, plenty of towells even though we only stayed 2 nights and all the things you might need like tea & coffee making facilities, iron, hair dryer, phone, internet access. The one thing that was missing was a spa. We thought that the best room in the hotel would have a spa or atleat a bath but there was only a shower but it could fit 5 people in there...if you wanted to. We had a lovely view of Darling Harbour & it was a 2 min walk to Paddys markets & China Town. The staff were very helpful & friendly and well mannered. Just be careful walking around that area late at night. I felt a bit uneasy because its on a fairly quiet street and someone was stabbed on the street the day we got there but i guess that can happen anywhere. There arent a lot of restaurants near by unless you want chinese food so I suggest talking a short walk to Darling Harbour & eating at one of the many grat restaurants there. I would definately go back. Luckily we got a deal through a friend & only paid $150 a night. Its usually about $300 a night which is well worth it. Its also only a few mins walk to the Entertainment Centre so its perfect if your going to a concert there. One tip though: use the parking across the street, its only $10 a night compared to $35 a night in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Did the trick”
Reviews.Author: dlovatt
Reviews.Content: Just out for a night in the city, and this hotel fared fine. Great location, just 2 mins walk from Central, friendly staff, Nice view, King Bed. Didn't have time for the gym/pool. Unfortunately, much like many other hotels, internet is a huge rip-off,.

Reviews.Title: “Clean spacious room, central location”
Reviews.Author: jccharlie
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for work, and was working around the corner at the university so it was a great location for me. Very close to central station as well so it was easy to get to/from the airport (10 mins by train), and right in the heart of Chinatown with easy walk to Darling Harbour or the CBD. If you don't want to eat at the restaurant or have room service there are plenty of food outlets in the area. The room was spacious and clean with a King bed and an ensuite bathroom and foxtel tv. The couch in the room was a bit saggy but didn't bother me. The room service food was good and didn't take very long to arrive. Good hotel to stay in when traveling for work.

Reviews.Title: “Very bad feeling in this hotel”
Reviews.Author: st_hui
Reviews.Content: Unfriendly reception and bad services. Outdated and very very dirty bathroom and room have cockroach in the room. I can't believe this is a 4 star hotel. Very Very bad and dirty. I never been a hotel like that.

Reviews.Title: “Great value..Great location”
Reviews.Author: caramellokoala
Reviews.Content: Spacious room with King size bed. Chinatown on your doorstep. Best value in Sydney. Will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: NSWT
Reviews.Content: Unfriendly reception... with very basic rooms in need of renovation - only saving grace was the beds and pillows were very comfortable. Also be aware - there's no way you'll be allowed to check-in a little early at this hotel (even if your room is ready and cleaned). When i stayed there, due to my international flight (14 hours) I arrived at the hotel about 10:00am. I was hoping that I could maybe check-in a little early around 12:00 if my room was available.... though I was very rudely told that regardless if my room is ready or not I could not check in until 3:00pm period... When checking out (which took about 15 minutes) the reception seemed to be receiving a lot of complaints. I definitely wouldn't stay there again. Many better options in that district.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for what we needed”
Reviews.Author: iloveholidaysNorfolk
Reviews.Content: We were a little worried after reading other reviews but in Sydney you just literally need somewhere to lay your head at night. It was basic but it was clean, it was expensive for what it was but it was because it was over new year and all prices go up then! The hotel was little noisy - we were woken on 2 night - one night a baby cried for over an hour and the other night there were um 'adult activities' which weren't quiet and a rather annoying loudly laughing person! Take ear plugs, don't spend any time in the room other than for sleeping and showering and you won't go wrong. We found all staff at the hotel really helpful and no problems whatsover.

Reviews.Title: “Bathrooms need Refurbishment, but otherwise great”
Reviews.Author: ineedabreak82
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night and enjoyed our stay very much. Rooms are a good size with 2 Queen Size beds, 2 desks and a big bathroom. The room has been refurbished with new furniture, manchester, etc, but carpet and bathrooms look to not have been touched. The carpet was very worn and had some well weathered stains that were unfortunate. The bathroom looked like it had been there since the hotel was built in the early 80's (at a guess) with a very outdated vanity and shower. Overall comfortable with good staff, posh lobby area and good car parking facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Sydney”
Reviews.Author: BensAdventures
Reviews.Content: I recently decided to stay again at Citigate Central Sydney and I must say that it exceeded my expectations. The room (except the bathroom) looks to be recently painted, the bed and pillows were comfortable and the staff were pleasant. Also I found the room I was in was spacious and had a good view from the 15th floor. The location isn't too bad, and the price was great, only $140 per night. I'll stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Much Better Than Expected”
Reviews.Author: jrisles
Reviews.Content: Like most of you reading this review i stumbled across this motel when doing some research about where the family & I were going to stay when we flew into Sydney over the Australia Day long weekend recently. I traveled with my wife & two young children (2yrs & 7mths). We booked one of the Citigate Twin Queen Rooms for two nights. Let me state from the start there was ample room for us all even with the addition of a baby's cot the room was still spacious enough for my 2yr old to play with his toys etc. We stayed on the 12th Floor. Having two Queen Size beds in the same room is not something you get everyday and the beds themselves were very comfortable. The room was very clean on arrival and the weekend that we stayed in Sydney the temps were hitting high 30's low 40's (celcius) and the Air Conditioner worked a treat keeping us all very comfortable. We were provided with alot of extra towels & toiletries etc because of the children (i presume) without having to ask for it. Each bed had 4 pillows on it with a couple of spares in the cupboard as well. Can't say the view itself was fantastic .. overlooking Chinatown but it was ok and i really wasn't expecting much of a view given that this is not located near the harbour at all. But of a night it was nice with all the lights etc. Location is great .. just a couple of minutes walk to Central Railway Station and you are right next door to China Town/Paddys Market & a few minutes walk to Darlling Harbour. One morning we had a single American Breakfast and even that was good value for money. Feeding all four of us!! The foyer/atrium area is very nice and comfortable with a lot of seating areas for family to sit and wait when we checked in/out etc. The reception staff were always pleasant and polite One area i did get caught out on was the fact this hotel does not have car parking (we hired a car for the weekend). There is a car park right next door to the hotel which you can use but it does cost. It cost us an extra $AU23.00 per day (24hrs) which in Sydney is very good (even exceptional) value. You just need to make sure that if you require a car park you let reception know asap to arrange a parking ticket that allows you come in and out of the car parking facility as many times as you like. Another thing that neither my wife nor i have yet enquired about was the fact that the hotel put a $1.00 credit charge on our credit card for no apparent reason? When you first book in they ask for your credit card to take a swipe of it so they can charges things to your credit card in case you use the min-bar or damage the hotel in any way. So looking at our Credit Card statment we realised they hit us up for a dollar .. for what i don't know. We never used the mini-bar and frankly you can't purchase anything for a dollar from the mini-bar anyhow. Not a big deal but if they do that to everyone that stays there that is not a bad windfall when you think about it! If you can find a better value motel in Sydney i'd like to hear about it!! If ever we have a need to go back to Sydney we will most definitely be looking to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service, room smelt of smoke”
Reviews.Author: stormo
Reviews.Content: I would never go back to this hotel. After 3 weeks of excellent hotels and service on the Sunshine Coast in Queensland we were dropped back down to earth when checking in. First of all, we booked 2 rooms as there were 4 of us, when checking in they had us down for 1 room, 2 double beds (1 being a settee). We argued and argued with different people until they agreed to put us in two separate rooms (no apology or anything). Then one of the 2 no smoking rooms we were given smelt of smoke. Not just smoke but fresh smoke. The carpets in both rooms were also stained and needed a good clean and the shower in 1 room was not working properly. It seems that with this hotel if you a business prerson they accomodate you, if you are on holiday you are just an inconvenience. To top it off, we wanted a taxi and when we asked it was as if it was a hassle to ring. The location is not too good either, right in the middle of chinatown. $8 for 1 hour of internet access is extortionate and everything that is in your room you have to pay for. I would never go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Charged additional money afterwards - without reason!”
Reviews.Author: BiB08
Reviews.Content: Our stay itself wasn't terrible, but what happened afterwards was more than that! When paying the bill with my european credit card an AUD and a Euro ammount was shown. I asked twice, whether I will be charged in AUD, being aware the the exchange rate wasn't good. I was twice told that I will be charged in AUD. Checking my account later, I saw that they charged for the bad Euro rate - that cost me about 10 Euro (approx. 20 AUD). OK, I checked the receipt again and saw that I signed to accept this - my fault but however a really bad behaviour of the receptionist I think. But it came better - some days later I realized that they charged additional 3 Euro from my credit card. I tried to contact the hotel twice per mail, without any reaction. That's a really presuming behaviour! I know that it's not really a big amount of money, but it's the principle. Besides that trouble the standard of the hotel is not 4.5 stars. Huge stains on the carpet and a perhaps 2 star bathroom. Small and old. After this experience, I will avoid to book a room in any of the hotels of this group.

Reviews.Title: “3 star room, 2 star service!”
Reviews.Author: cassandra83
Reviews.Content: I am normally willing to overlook small issues with customer service, however this place was no where near what a 4.5 star hotel should be like. I think because it is a very big conference centre, the individual customer does not matter. On five of the six occasions we had to deal with reception they were bordering between indifferent to very rude. We had booked a deluxe double room (king size bed) and were put in a twin room, this was not fixed. The room itself, looked like and old 3 star hotel with some new furniture. The carpet was badly stained all over, the desk was unclean, but the biggest issue was the bathroom. In all the 4 star hotels I have stayed at, none have come close to the one in the city gate central. It was OLD, small, and downright dingy. Hopefully the photos will do it justice, no wonder they donâ€™t show photos of it on the website The only positives were the soft beds with nice linen and large TV and location wise it is very close to central station and china town. Overall there are better places to stay in Sydney for better customer service and rooms, at similar rates.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable hotel in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: lshirai
Reviews.Content: Needed a reasonable priced 3-star hotel in central Sydney. Hotel wasn't right next to the Circular Quay but that wasn't our main priority and we just wanted to stay in a good hotel (not spectacular) in the middle of the city. Hotel provided everything we needed and there was a bus stop right nearby which we took to get to the city center and a train station which we could walk to in less than 5 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing stay in the end!”
Reviews.Author: claireban
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 night stay stay at the Citigate. Arriving at around 2pm on our internal flight from Sunshine Coast. Check in and out was a breeze and the room was light and spacious and very clean with a super city view on the 16th floor. We had paid Â£70 per night to include an executive room with breakfast for ease, although we need not have had breakfast included as there is an array of restuarants on the doorstep. The location of the hotel is superb for cheap eats in Chinatown and Paddys markets for cheap souveniers and the buses run from the end of the road to Circular Quay etc every few minutes. Unfortunately after we returned to our room from walking around the city the peace was broken by screaming children in the room next door (the only ones in the whole hotel I think!), the walls of the hotel must be very thin as it sounded like they were in the room with us. Breakfast was great, wonderfully presented and friendly Asian staff always smiling and nothing too much trouble as always. After our experiences the previous evening we asked at reception when our neighbours were checking out and unfortunately it was the same day we were so I asked if they wouldn't mind moving us. They completely understood, as I think there had been some noise at breakfast also. We were moved directly above to the 18th floor, but it seemed we had jumped out of the frying pan and into the fire as the fridge did not work and there was a strange buzzing noise which we established was coming from the airconditioning units on a wall adjacent to our window. So I asked if we could move again, I think patience was wearing a bit thin with the woman on reception but I thought why should we have our trip marred by this, it is four star otherwise we'd have booked in to the Wake Up across the road and paid half the price. The manager came out to speak to me and said it was not a problem at all and he personally checked the new room they were giving us which was across the landing, fair enough we did not have the city view we had before but we had a wonderful sunset view instead. All in all I would highly recommend this hotel for location/service/staff and cleanliness and on reflection perhaps the family with noisy children should have been the ones that were moved away from disturbing the other guests in the first place.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Convenient & Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: 101bm
Reviews.Content: I stay here a fair bit for work. I return here every 2 or 3 weeks as I believe it is good value for money, especially as the hotels in Sydney can be quite pricey. As previously stated it is right next to Chinatown so there are heaps of chinese restaurants along Dixon St. Also close to the Capitol Theatre & Central Station. Easy walk to Darling Harbour, Entertainment Centre & surrounds. Check in & out are always quick & efficient. Beds reasonably comfy. No real view to speak of. Internet in the rooms is expensive. Could do with a few more Foxtel channels. Carparking is an extra $20/day.

Reviews.Title: “Not a problem.”
Reviews.Author: Bogiboy
Reviews.Content: First, I would normally give this kind of hotel 3 stars. However, most hotels in Sydney seem over-priced these days and it was delightful to find a good place, in a good location at a good price. I stayed here when was the Carlton Crest and, besides the new (simplified) lobby, not a lot has changed. The staff are friendly and knowledgeable of the local area and the rooms are comfortable. I have read a lot of negative comments about this end of town, but I much prefer it to the northern end of the city. There are plenty of great restaurants (especially Chinese) and Paddy's market is only a 2-minute walk. As one of the other posters mentioned, stay there if you can get a good package/rate.

Reviews.Title: “Good clean business hotel”
Reviews.Author: Misha J
Reviews.Content: I stayed here late 2007 for a couple of nights in Sydney on business. I was weary about a) being dumped into a hotel in Chinatown near the Uni of Technology and b) staying at a hotel "formerly known as the Carlton Crest" ...When a hotel uses the 'formerly known' angle - things must be bad. They weren't. I was pleasantly suprised by the Citigate and would happily stay there again - as a business traveller. Nestled in the heart of Chinatown - Broadway and Ultimo are a stonesthrow - and it is a short walk into town. There is no 'budget' or 'uni student' feel to the establishment. The best thing about the Citigate is that you walk out the door and have wonderful restaurants (i.e. Chinatown) at your doorstep. The foyer seems quite grand - though figuring out how to get to the lifts or carpark entrance is quite a struggle. The lifts are probably the worst part of the hotel and I am sure there are two child labourers under the shatfs raising and lowering the lifts with a systems of ropes and pullies. Apart from that it was great. Business services were adequate (car park a bit far from Hotel - but included in price), the rooms had gorgeous views of Sydney and I mentioned the proximity to great Asian restaurants. For international travellers - Central Station is just down the road. I would visit again - though (as I have said) probably only on business.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice- affordable weekend away!”
Reviews.Author: bamb00s
Reviews.Content: We stayed for the long weekend - special occassion. I booked on wotif.com and requested a non smoking room with a nice view. We got a room on the 12th floor. The staff were friendly and the room was nice and clean. The furniture was nice- recently refubished. The hotel is located on a quiet street in china town. There are plenty of cheap places to eat near by and Darling Habour and city central are walking distance (don't where heels =o). I reccommend the Dela France on George st for brekkie or naughty snack. Yummy quiches, french pastries and beautiful coffee - open 24/7. mini bar is overpriced but there is a conveniance store accross the road. Over all I really enjoyed my stay at the citigate central. I liked that it wasnt in the heart of the city - it was a bit more relaxed and there wasn't swarms of people everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Prime Location, Excellent for Families”
Reviews.Author: Sian006
Reviews.Content: I have recently returned from the Citigate Central with my partner and also met up with my family over there. Check in was very easy and they gave us rooms next door to each other. The rooms were very clean and comfortable for what we paid and I find any one travelling with a family will not be disappointed with this hotel. The hotel is situated right by the Paddy's Markets (within 2 minutes walk) and two blocks away is the monorail which will take you to the heart of Darling Harbour as well as around the city centre so you can hop off and on where ever you like (AUD9.00 for an all day pass and family passes are cheaper). From Darling Harbour you can catch a ferry around to the rocks (still very cheap about AUD5.00) and have a look around the rocks markets which are fantastic as well as go under the Sydney Harbour bridge and beside the Sydney Opera House. Also from where you catch the monorail you can catch the tram and go to the fish markets for all you seafood lovers. I believe it is definately a great hotel in a prime location without paying the costs of staying in Darling Harbour itself!!!

Reviews.Title: “Location good, if you can get it cheap”
Reviews.Author: KylieOberon
Reviews.Content: I think the moral to the story is that if you can get a good cheap rate and just want somewhere that is reasonable and is close to darling harbour/china town- then this is a good option. If you are looking for romantic/ relaxing / atmosphere- not the place for you. It is certainly adequate and comnvenient but that is about as far as it goes. Staff were very nice Note to smokers- hotel is non smoking now - except for rooms with a balcony- so ask for one of those if you are a smoker

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but very old hotel”
Reviews.Author: Amanda53
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in March for 7 days. The hotel is in a great location, been minutes from Central station and the numerous buses down to Circular Quay. The hotel room was very large but also very outdated especially the bathroom which could do with a good clean as well! Considering what we paid for 7 nights, I would not recommend this hotel - however I would recommend this area.

Reviews.Title: “Functional”
Reviews.Author: serialmonkey
Reviews.Content: Clean, good service, well suited for business travelers. Breakfast/Restaurant is average. Wired broadband in the rooms, wireless in the lobby, expensive all round. 5 minute walk to Central Station and Market City. Worth the stay if you are working in this area - otherwise just head further into the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DavidTAustralia
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a little hard to find, being tucked away at the end of Thomas Street. Once you do find it however, you realise the perfect location !! Its right near Chinatown, Paddy's Market and an easy stroll to the harbour. The hotel has had a renovation and the foyer, restaurant and rooms are fantastic. The only thing lacking in the room we had was the bathroom. I really despise paying good money for a room only to find it has a shower curtain instead of a glass shower housing (just a little quirk of mine). The hotel itself was quite nice, however, the service was not ideal. The concierge was a little snooty and cleary thought that the cut to my friends leg and buttock sustained from the rough edges of the soap holder where of no great concern. Apart from this, our experience at this hotel was quite good. Ask for a harbour view room if possible!!

Reviews.Title: “Very dsappointing”
Reviews.Author: HunterNindy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Citigate last week-end and were very disappointed with the customer service and blandness of the hotel rooms and reception area. There was no storage space for clothing other than hanging space, and the only light in the very small bathroom was over the vanity mirror. After returning from the Mardi Gras Parade at 10.30pm we discovered the hotel bar was closed, and we were told rather curtly we could drink in our room. While the location was good, it does look out onto what looked like a bomb site. The service lift was out of order so the hotel staff had to travel in the guest lifts with trollies etc, and on more than one occasion when the lift arrived it was not possible to get in because of staff transporting dirty crockery linen etc. We stayed with a couple visiting us from the UK and were embarressed at the choice we had made having stayed in much better Sydney hotels in the past for less than we paid at the Citigate.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: SwishMelb
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week during a buisness trip. Room was comfortable and the staff were nice. All of the cheap eateries close by were good. Try the asian noodle soup joint around the corner! It really good!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: ASB76
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Citigate Central Hotel was great - the location is fantastic, the staff were always extremely friendly and helpful, the room was very clean and spacious - absolutely no complaints. We got great rates and realised when we got there that it was probably because the hotel is undergoing renovations at the moment, but it didn't affect us in the slightest. (We were up on the 10th floor so lower floors might be affected..not sure though...). We had a room with 2 queen beds and there were 4 of us girls but still more than enough space for all of our suitcases etc. The only thing that went wrong was the hairdryer in the bathroom stopped working on the 2nd day, but a replacement arrived about 5 minutes after we called reception. The little rooftop pool is great, too! Underground parking is also considerably cheaper than other city hotels, so a great deal all round! Will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel,Great location”
Reviews.Author: windyhabour
Reviews.Content: This is a clean hotel with large rooms,well appointed.ALL hotel staff were professional,friendly & helpful in all matters.I was really impressed with the high standard for such a reasonable price.Location is central to everything...yet on a quiet street.Will definately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Stellar Experience”
Reviews.Author: southynorthy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here only one night and was pleasantly surprised by appearance of Citigate and professionalism of front desk staff upon arrival. Was upgraded to one of only four suites on the 18th floor without even asking-the suite was larger than some apartments I've lived in. Travelling with a 2 year old and 3 month old I was impressed they took the time to bump us up and it was greatly appreciated as they could have kept us in a standard room (which I'm sure would have been adequate). Ordered a baby cot which arrived within minutes of checking in and then room service. Food was adequate-soup was excellent. Location was perfect-a 5 minute walk to Central Station so you could stay here and go anywhere easily within city or outer burbs-was a $33 cab ride from the airport. The hotel seems to spring out of nowhere-area is obviously getting developed but if you're not fussy about a harbour view I would forgo all that for pleasant, professional staff and clean, comfortable, reasonably priced room. Would stay here again anytime in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best I've stayed at in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Leonardsworth
Reviews.Content: I booked this on a discount website at a very good price and thus didn't know what to expect. I was very pleasantly surprised by how wonderful the Citigate Central was. It is tucked away on an obscure street but just off a main street (George), and is very conveniently located...a 5 minute walk to Central Railway Station. The front desk staff were VERY helpful and accomodating and gave me my room prior to check-in time. The room was very bright, airy, clean, and modern. Comfortable bed. Great views. Again, very clean. Everything has been recently remodeled and there is still some renovation going on. Nice rooftop pool. One of the best hotels I've stayed at in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad and reasonable value for Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Tricolours
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Citgate for two nights at the end of November. I found the overall experience satisfactory and felt with the deal I had got which included breakfeast at $AUD189 per night was reasonable value for Sydney. The hotel is really a typical four star property (even though they give themselves 4 &1/2) and I found it to be clean, and reasonably maintained with large rooms and relatively comfortable beds. The reason I say it is 4 star is it just lacks some of the trappings of luxury required to be at that next level. My overall experience with the staff was generally positive although the desk staff need a little more training as a few of my simple requests confused them pretty quickly but they were at least polite. My only minor negatives are the lifts which are inadequate and at peak times are painfully slow, and the location. It is not a particularly pretty part of Sydney but luckily the nicer surrounds of Darling Harbour & Cockle Bay are only a 10 min stroll away. Overall if you are in town and only require somewhere to lay your head that a) isn't a dump but b) isn't going to break your budget, then the Citigate fits the bill nicely.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly welcoming service.”
Reviews.Author: Elcroz
Reviews.Content: Check the various 'last minute' type websites for great value packages for this hotel. Had the best time on a dinner bed and breakfast 'Spring Package'. The location was perfect for what we wanted - access to Darling Harbour and the Capitol Theatre. The executive king room offered on this deal was very spacious and clean and on the top floor with city views. Service throughout was helpful and professional. We especially enjoyed the taste and presentation of the meals at dinner in the restaurant. This was a great hotel and represented exceptional value comparatively for Sydney accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “$29/day for internet access? Outrageous”
Reviews.Author: geoffyvr
Reviews.Content: Citigate charges 55 cents a minute for broadband internet access, to a maximum of $29/day. I found this shocking. Why would a business traveller want to stay here? I certainly won't stay there again. Other than the unreasonable internet use charge, the hotel was your basic business-chain-buys-an-older-hotel-and-rebrands-it. A few rough edges, but overall a reasonable place to stay. Somewhat characterless, in the way that most business-style hotels are.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: BenVK85
Reviews.Content: Booked this place on wotif.com and got a great deal. Included Queen bed, Parking and Breakfast. Staff were fantastic and happy to help with anything, even the house keepers were very happy and chirpy in the mornings. The room must have been renovated within the last 12 months because it was fantastic, new looking paint, bathroom looked modern, no leaky taps! Fridge is tiny, can only fit one 2L bottle in there. The bed was fantastic, big queen bed with fantastic quilt. plenty of carparking, so this is not an issue. Will be staying here again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Good Service, room ok”
Reviews.Author: Warrens_of_Conder
Reviews.Content: We stayed her for two nights over Easter (2A &2C). The hotel has just been taken over by the Citigate Group and is in the process of being rebranded. We have stayed here several times( as Carlton Crest Hotel) as it is close to Darling Harbour, Paddys Market, Syd Entertainment Centre and China Town. The hotel has its own car park which offers a discount rate, and due to the design of the hotel (seven floors of parking, then about eight floors of Hotel) you get virtually no street noise, a real bonus. Try to book a balcony room on floor eight, some of which have a garden/pool view. Check in staff excellent, pleasant and helpful. Rooms are on the smaller side, but clean and adequate. Room service meals were quick and the quality good, however the choice is a little limited. Great shower (heaps of pressure and no lack of hot water). We had breakfast in the Bezzara Cafe which was very good, plenty of choice and a buffet that was being constantly serviced. Now Negatives, only a couple. The bed was very 'firm' and resulted in a sore back for both myself and my wife. The Bathrooms need renovation (generally tired with taps hard to turn off (people without a firm grip would have trouble turning the taps), cracked tile etc, but still clean). Although we booked for 2A & 2C when we arrived we did not have sufficient towels, this was fixed in less than 3 minutes after a call to reception, fastest houskeeping service I have encountered! Overall we had a good stay and would stay again. Room Rates are excellent for the area.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: NW_Happy_Feet
Reviews.Content: Nice rooms. close to monorail, Chinatown. 15 minute walk to Darling Harbor. Helpful staff. In-hotel restaurant was mediocre. Good wired in-room broadband internet access but expensive at $Au 0.55/min, max $Au 29 /day. All-in-all a pleasant stay at a resonable price. Note: While we were there, this hotel was in the process of being re-named as Citygate Central, but as of 3/29/07 it is still listed as Carlton Crest on their website. This may change in the near future.
